Sandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el credito para comprar insecticidas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crèdito podrá comprar los materiales para trabajar en el campo. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

El sueño es tener mejores cosechas y por ende los ingresos que mejoren. En el tiempo libre le gusta despejar la mente paseando por el campo.
texts.en: Sandra is 43 and is divorced with two children. She lives with her children in Cantón Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the group VRC la CHONTA, who are located in the Recinto la Chonta area of Cantón Ventanas and work in agriculture and farming livestock. Sandra also works in agriculture growing corn, soya and rice. She is asking for a loan to buy insecticides and fertilisers. With the help of a loan she will be able to buy the materials she needs for working in the fields. She will purchase them in Ventanas. Her dream is to have better harvests and thereby increase her profits. In her free time she likes to clear her head by walking in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilisers.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen tiene 23 años, es soltera, y vive en su casa propia junta de sus padres. Karen se dedica a la venta de comidas  regionales, contando con un restaurante ubicado en su propia casa, donde tiene varias mesas y sillas para sus clientes, que son atendidos de manera amable y cordial. Además los fines de semana venden parrilladas de pollos que son muy requeridos por su buena sazón. Tiene más de 05 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento su mamá es quien más la ayuda, atendiendo a los clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico constante que le sirve para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Considera rentable a su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, por tanto tiene planes de continuar en el negocio buscando hacerlo crecer. Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado 300 nuevos soles, comprará ingredientes para  preparar sus comidas  como arroz, azúcar, y otros.
texts.en:
Karen is twenty-three years old, is single, and lives in at home with her parents.  Karen makes a living selling regional foods, and has a restaurant located in her own home.  She has several tables and chairs for her customers, and she attends to them with a kind and cordial manner.  Additionally, she sells barbecued chicken on the weekends, which is in demand because of its rich flavor.  

She has been dedicated to this work for more than five years.  So far, her mother is the person who has helped her most in attending to the clients.  She likes her business because she generates a stable economic income that helps her to cover the home expenses.  She considers her business to be profitable due to the earnings it has given her.  She has plans to continue with this business, and to find ways to make it grow.  

This will be her first loan with Kiva.  She hopes for your collaboration so that she can make her dreams come true.  With the amount she has requested (300 soles), she will invest in the purchase of the ingredients she needs in order to prepare her foods, like rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like rice and sugar, in order to prepare her food items.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Amanecer está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas están con una gran expectativa de poder ser capacitadas, y de esa forma poder mejorar sus vidas e ir adquiriendo mayor conocimiento.
Soraida es una mujer ejemplar, luchadora, emprendedora, y que quiere trabajar para salir adelante, vende todo tipo de comidas rápidas que ella misma hace y con lo cual deleita a sus clientes. Hoy solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, huevos, tomate, lechuga, locotes, papa, cebolla y demás insumos que pueda necesitar para poder seguir haciendo sus ricas comidas.
Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad de acceder al crédito que recibe, ya que es la primera vez que recibe esta oportunidad
texts.en:
This group, named Amanecer [Daybreak], is in the first cycle of the women's committee program, in which they have great hope to be able to be trained and in this way to be able to improve their lives and continue acquiring more knowledge.

Soraida is an exemplary woman, determined, hard-working and willing to work to get ahead. She sells a variety of fast foods that she prepares herself and that her customers love. Today she is seeking part of this loan in order to purchase meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs, tomatoes, lettuce, green peppers, potatoes, onions and other supplies that she needs in order to be able to continue making her delicious food.

She is very grateful for this opportunity to obtain the loan that she is receiving, since it is the first time that she has had this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs, tomatoes, lettuce, green peppers, potatoes, onions and other supplies.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, a sus 20 años de edad es empleado de una finca donde trabaja como ordeñador de vacas, actividad que aprendió gracias a su hermano mayor que le enseñó desde pequeño, ya que viven en el campo, donde es común realizar esta labor. Pertenece a una familia humilde y la situación económica en el hogar es difícil. Con su empleo como ordeñador, Alejandro ha podido generar ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades diarias de su familia,  y adicionalmente tiene 2 vacas de su propiedad, en un pequeño terreno arrendado, las cuales ordeña diariamente para vender la leche y así tener un recurso adicional. El prestatario es un joven dinámico y emprendedor, por eso se motivó a solicitar el primer crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más vacas lecheras y, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos, además pretende cumplir su principal sueño que es tener muchas vacas productoras de leche y hacer crecer su negocio, para continuar apoyando la situación económica en su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en: Alejandro is 20 years old. He works in a farm as milker, an activity he has learned from his older brother who taught him when Alejandro was young: they live in the country and there this type of job is quite common. He comes from a modest family and the economic situation of his household is difficult. Working as an milker, Alejandro has succeeded in earning an income to provide for the daily necessities of his family. He also owns 2 cows he breeds in a small plot he pays rent for: he daily milks them to sell their milk and earn an additional income. This borrower is a dynamic and resourceful young man, and for this reason he decided to ask for his first loan: he will use it to purchase more dairy cows in order to increase his earnings. He also wants to making his biggest dream come true: owing many dairy cows and make his activity grow in order to keep on economically supporting his household and to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Alma works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from selling prepared foods.

Alma is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her frozen foods business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 27-year-old married man. He is the father for one son and one daughter. Bilal is living in a humble house with his family in Hebron. Bilal is working as painter in Dora. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him. He earns a very small salary which is not enough to cover the needed expenses; he also needs more support to cover the costs. 

Bilal wants to purchase more equipment to improve his work and make it more profitable; this will increase the family’s source of income. Bilal is requesting a $2,000 USD loan from FATEN to purchase the needed equipment. Bilal is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to improve his painting work.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton, de 35 años, es un hombre bueno, trabajador y con una visión de negocio muy buena, es casado y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Milton tiene como trabajo la venta productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, detergentes, granos, alimentos balanceados y otros. Realiza este trabajo en su bodega que ha instalado en un espacio de su vivienda. Lleva ya 2 años en esta actividad, la cual realiza con ayuda de su esposa, al principio le fue un poco complicado empezar ya que no tenia ninguna experiencia en este negocio, pero con el tiempo aprendió y ahora tiene las pautas necesarias para tener contentos a su clientes. Eventualmente complementa su labor con la compra y venta de ganado vacuno. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la continuidad de las ventas y la fluidez con la que llegan sus clientes a realizar diversas compras, además cuando tiene tiempo libre lo dedica a realizar otras funciones en su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 y se siente agradecido de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante con su negocio.
Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos comestibles tales como arroz, aceite, leche y otros.
texts.en:
Milton, 35, is a good and hardworking man with a very good business vision.  He's married and has three children who live with him in his own house.

Milton's job is selling food products such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, detergent, grains, animal feed, and other things.  He does his work in the store he has set up in a space in his house.  He has done this work for two years with the help of his wife.

In the beginning it was a little complicated for him because he didn't have any experience in this business.  In time he learned, however, and now he has the necessary standards to keep his customers happy.  Sometimes he supplements his work by buying and selling cattle.

What he likes about his job is the continuity of sales and how regularly his customers shop.  When he has free time he does other things in his home.

Currently he'll request 2000 soles [PEN].  He's grateful about receiving financial help that allows him to get ahead with his business.

With the requested amount he'll buy more food products such as rice, oil, milk, and other things.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, milk, and other food products

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus has been in the trucking business for more than five years in Laredo, Texas. His company, Jesus R. Trucking, transports goods throughout and beyond the state of Texas. Jesus spends most of his nights on the road, but loves the openness of the road and his freedom.

One day, Jesus was discussing his business plans with a friend and active Accion Texas Inc. borrower. Jesus’ friend, Pedro, advised him to talk with an Accion representative and apply for a business loan. Jesus inquired and applied, and shortly afterward, Jesus was approved for a $5,450 Accion loan.

The loan went towards regular maintenance on his truck and additional capital for his trucking business. Jesus also saved a piece of the loan for future maintenance and an emergency fund for unexpected incidents.

For now, Jesus continues to deliver his goods and maintain his business. He does not plan to hire additional employees at the moment, but is considering it for the future.

loans.use: to pay for current and future maintenance of his truck.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 64-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has eight grown children. She engages in a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells various items like biscuits, salted peanuts, coffee, cooking oil and noodles. She has been operating the retail store business for almost 10 years.

Veronica requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, rice and corn, to fill her store with stock. Veronica hopes that she could expand her retail store business to provide proper diets, and to set aside some money in preparation for her old age.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice and corn, to resell at her store

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 36 years old and married. She has four children who are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Adela runs a business, buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell. Adela has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Luis Hernando

texts.es: Hernando, a sus 56 años de edad, es padre de 5 hijos y vive con su esposa. Creció en el campo, al lado de sus padres, quienes le enseñaron las labores agrícolas y, gracias a eso ahora tiene cultivos de fríjol, café, plátano y tomate de aliño, cuenta con 3 invernaderos, donde protege sus cultivos para poder tener una buena cosecha con un producto de muy buena calidad y así poder venderlo más fácil en el mercado y generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de toda su familia. Hernando, es un hombre emprendedor, trabajador y muy dedicado y, a pesar de todos los obstáculos que se le presentan a nivel económico, siempre ha podido salir adelante, por eso quiere contar con el apoyo de un segundo ciclo de crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (fungicidas, insecticidas, larvicidas y abonos) y reabonar el cultivo de tomate, para tener una mejor cosecha de  sus productos. Él sueña con tener otros 3 invernaderos ya que cuenta con el terreno suficiente para instalarlos y de esta forma podrá ampliar sus cultivos, incrementar sus ventas y mejorar los ingresos, para ofrecerles un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Hernando is 56 years old, has five children, and lives with his wife.  He grew up in the countryside with his parents, who taught him about farming, and thanks to that knowledge, he now cultivates bean, coffee, bananas, and tomatoes.  He has three greenhouses where he protects his crops so that he can have a good harvest with a good quality product.  This allows him to sell his crops more easily at the market and generate income to support all of his family.

Hernando is an enterprising, hardworking, and dedicated man. In spite of the economic obstacles that he faced, he has always been able to move forward.  He wants to count on the support of a second loan cycle to invest in farm supplies such as fungicides, insecticides, larvicides, and fertilizers.and refertilize his tomato crop so that he can have a better harvest of his products.  

His dream is to have three more greenhouses since he has sufficient land to install them, and this will allow him to expand his crops, increase his sales, and improve his income.  This will allow him to offer his wife and children a better well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies (fungicide, insecticide, larvicide, and fertilizer).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school expenses and to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ulmaskan

texts.ru: Улмаскан, 50 лет, замужем, 4 детей (4 сына). Образование - среднее. С 1990 года занимается садоводством и полеводством, точнее занимается выращиванием саженцев, таких как: вишня, слива, черешня, абрикос и персик для продажи. Бизнес начала с 2000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она успешный садовод своего небольшого хозяйства, а в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 4 ГА земельного надела, на которой она ежегодно выращивает саженцы. Реализует саженцы в соседние страны, такие как: Россия, Узбекистан. Ежемесячная прибыль Улмаскан составляет 10000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего садоводческого хозяйства, Улмаскан обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS)  на покупку саженцев и удобрений для них. Дети Улмаскан помогают вести домашнее хозяйство. На доходы от кредита Улмаскан планирует улучшить благосостояние семьи. Семья очень уважаемая в селе и дружная.
texts.en: Ulmaskan is 50 years old, married and has four children--all sons.  She has a high school diploma.  She has worked in agriculture since 1990, more specifically, raising seedlings including cherry, plum, apricot and pears to sell.  She started her business in 2000.  Today, she is a success with her small farm which is on four hectares of land that she plants each year.  She sells her crops in neighboring countries like Russia and Uzbekistan.  Her monthly profit is around 10,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her agricultural endeavors, Ulmaskan has turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy seedlings and fertilizer for them.  Ulmaskan's children will help her with her duties duties.  She plans to use the income from the loan to improve her family's well being.  Her family is very respected in their village, as well as friendly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Kenjegul

texts.ru: Кенжегуль, 40 лет, незамужем, имеет 1 сына школьного возраста. С 2005 года занимается реализацией продуктов питания и прохладительных напитков, имеет свой продуктовый павильон. Бизнес начала с 10000 сом (KGS). Благодаря неустанному труду и терпению Кенжегуль успешно увеличила размеры своего небольшого бизнеса, и ежемесячная прибыль составила 15000 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса  и приумножения прибыли Кенжегуль обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 40 000 сом (KGS)  на расширение торговли и подготовку продукции. На доходы от кредита Кенжегуль хочет дать достойное образование сыну.
texts.en: Kenjegul is 40 years old, unmarried and has one school-aged son.  Since 2005, she has sold food products and cold drinks from her own grocery pavilion.  She started the business with 10,000 KGS.  Thanks to her tireless efforts and patience, Kenjegul has successfully increasesd the size of her small business and her monthly profits bring in 15,000 KGS.  With the goal of further business development and increasing profits, she has turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 KGS for the expansion of inventory and production.  Kenjegul wants to use the income from the loan to give her son a worthy education.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, of Calamba, Misamis Occidental, supports her family through nipa (hut weaving business). She is 20 years old, married with one child, and tries her best to earn on her own. For more than three years she has managed this business and earns about 4,000 PHP per month. 

Currently, she needs additional capital to buy raw materials such as straw, nipa leaves and bamboo sticks. In 2012 she joined GDMPC and requests a loan of 7,000 PHP to cover the costs of her needs. Jennifer desires to improve her business to have a better, more comfortable living in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as straw, nipa leaves and bamboo sticks.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed grocery items for her variety store. The loan also helped in the education of her children and in her household expenditures. In addition to her variety store, she has a canteen and a parlor, and also creates handicraft products for additional income. She and her husband are working to provide a good future for their family.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lorna dreams. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Alma has been in this business for five years. Alma earns additional income from a general store.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a catering vehicle to deliver his food to customers.

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан, 43 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей (1 сын и 1 дочь). Образование-средне-специальное, работает медсестрой в местной больнице. С 2000 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5000 сом (KGS). Супруг Анаркан помогает по хозяйству, откармливает и перепродает скот. Ежемесячный доход ее семьи составляет 15000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, на сегодняшний день она имеет небольшое  хозяйство: 3 дойные коровы. У Анаркан имеются все условия для содержания скота. Прибыль позволила Анаркан увеличить поголовье скота в хозяйстве. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота с дальнейшим откармливанием и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также в будущем дать достойное высшее образование своим детям.
texts.en: Anarkan is 43 years old, married and has two children (one son and one daughter).  She has a secondary-specialized education and works as a nurse at a local hospital.  She has been involved in an agricultural business - animal husbandry and farming - since 2000, having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Anarkan's husband helps her with the business by feeding and reselling livestock.  The family's monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Anarkan's hard work, today she has a small business, containing three dairy cows.  Anarkan has all of the conditions for keeping livestock.  The profit allowed her to increase livestock headcount in her household.  In order to further develop her business, Anarkan requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy livestock for future fattening up and resale.  Anarkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further increase of livestock quantity and to provide a decent education for her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy livestock for future fattening up and resale

loans.name: Conchita Group

texts.es:
Conchita es un grupo integrado por 8 personas emprendedoras las cuales desarrollan una actividad económica con el objetivo de brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en Tres Valles y sus principales fuentes de empleo se encuentra en la siembra y cultivo de piñas y caña de azúcar. 

Don Gaudencio es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, él platica que  desde hace un poco mas de 15 años instaló una pequeña granja de cría y engorda de cerdos en su hogar, el dice que le gusta mucho su actividad ya que es su propia fuente de empleo y lo ha ayudado ha sacar adelante a su familia durante varios años, el comenta que su actividad lo mantiene ocupado todo el día ya que por las mañanas les de de comer a sus cerdos y limpia sus corrales y posteriormente sale por las casas de su comunidad a recoger los botes de desperdicios que la gente junta y asi no invierte tanto en alimentos para sus animalitos. El ademas realiza ventas de queso para obtener algunos ingresos extras.

Gaudencio ha solicitado este credito a VisionFund  ya que desea invertirlo en la compra de algunos cerdos, alimentos y desparacitantes para continuar con su actividad. 

A futuro, le gustaría poder hacer unas mejoras a su hogar y brindar a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida. 

Gaudencio agradece el apoyo que se le ha brindado a el y a su grupo por medio de estos créditos.

Los demás integrantes de grupo son:

Blanca venta de cosmeticos
Jaime venta de de comida 
Ruben club de nutricion 
Macario servicio de albañileria
Lucía venta de antojitos 
Amado venta de dulces 
Magdalena venta de ropa
texts.en:
The Conchita group is made up of 8 entrepreneurs who are developing their businesses to provide their families with a better quality of life. This group is located in Tres Valles, a region with a high employment in pineapple and sugar cane cultivation. 

Gaudencio is one of the members of this group. He explains that just over 15 years ago he established a small farm near his home to breed and raise pigs. He says that he really enjoys this work because it is his source of employment and it has helped him to support his family for several years. He notes that this job keeps him busy all day. In the morning he feeds the pigs and cleans their styes. He then visits the neighbouring homes in his community to collect the waste that people put out. This way he does not need to invest as much in food for the animals. He also sells cheese to supplement his income. 

Gaudencio has requested this loan from VisionFund because he wants to purchase some pigs, food and deparasite treatments so that he can continue with his work. 

In the future, he hopes to be able to make some home improvements and provide his wife with a better quality of life. 

Gaudencio appreciates the support that he and the group have been given through these loans. 

The other members of the group include: 
Blanca, who sells cosmetics
Jaime, who sells food
Ruben, who operates a nutrition club 
Macario, who works in masonry
Lucia, who sells snacks
Amado, who sells candy
Magdalena, who sells clothing.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and food.

loans.name: Aluncia

texts.en:
Aluncia is 50 years old and married with eleven children.

Aluncia earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries and to purchase additional seeds and other farm supplies.

Aluncia has been farming vegetables for 20 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries and to purchase additional seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia began her business, ISR Cenla, LLC, six months ago in Alexandria, Louisiana.  ISR, or Infant Swimming Rescue, works with children ages six months to six years old and teaches them how to self-rescue themselves in water.  According to the latest Center for Disease Control and Prevention report, “drowning is the leading cause of injury death among children aged 1 – 4 years.”  It is the third leading cause of death in Louisiana.

ISR begins teaching the children how to roll over and float until they are rescued. Children over one year of age learn how to do the same but also turn over and swim until they reach a safe place. These children learn to not overly exert themselves to the point of exhaustion.

Olivia believes children and their families should have the tools necessary to survive in the water. ISR also incorporates learning about other ways to prevent drowning incidents. Examples include setting up pool fences, alarmed doors and locking windows leading to the pool when children are wandering, having a certified CPR family or friend prepared, and most important, effective adult supervision. Each of these preventive measures helps reduce the risk of children falling in a pool.

Olivia went to the Small Business Development Center in Alexandria and was referred to Accion Texas Inc. for a business loan. Once Olivia received approval for a $5,450 Accion loan, she used her loan for training materials, website production, start-up fees, and certification fees to be able to teach ISR. Olivia continues to educate the community about ISR and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for training materials, website production, start-up fees, and certification fees to be able to teach ISR (Infant Swimming Rescue) to children.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling hollow blocks and cement in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional cement and hollow blocks for her business to sell.

Amy has been in this business for eight years. Amy earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising pigs.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional cement and hollow blocks to sell

loans.name: Restita

texts.en:
This is Restita, 56, resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Raul and is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Restita is a soft drinks dealer. She buys large quantities of soft drinks from a soft drink factory then sells it to different variety stores. Her ability to please people gives her more loyal customers. She also has a variety store for additional income.  She earns a minimum of 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more soft drink varieties to expand her product inventory. She will also use the loan to buy grocery items for her variety store.

Restita dreams of expanding her business and hopes to improve her family's living condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more soft drinks needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is running a tailoring shop from the front of her house. She will use the loan to buy stocks of fabric to keep in her store. She is making good money from sewing fabric and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sew together

loans.name: Alina Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es casada y aún no tiene hijos. Ella siempre ha sido empleada en diversos almacenes, en los cuales adquirió experiencia en la actividad comercial, lo que la motivó a iniciar su propio negocio. Margarita es una persona con visión, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por eso se motivó a solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito que invertirá en el montaje de un almacén de misceláneas y accesorios para celulares para lo que requiere comprar surtido y activos fijos (vitrinas,  carcazas, equipos, cargadores, protectores de pantalla) y adicionalmente hacer mejoras en el local; con este almacén ella pretende mejorar la difícil situación económica que atraviesa actualmente. Margarita sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y trasladarlo a un local propio ubicado en una zona mucho más comercial y reconocida, así podrá aumentar sus ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Margarita is a 25-year-old woman, she is married and she has no children yet. Having always worked for different stores, she has gained an experience in trade activities that has motivated her to establish her own shop. Being a woman with a vision and a resourceful person with a great desire to get ahead in life, Margarita has decided to start her first loan cycle. She will invest the loan in the setting up of a convenience and mobile phones accessories store, and for this she needs to buy assortment and some fixed assets(showcase, computer cases, equipment, chargers, screensavers); on top of this she also has to make improvements in her locale; thanks to this warehouse she wishes to improve the economically difficult period she is actually going through. Margarita dreams of making her activity grow and to relocate it in a place she owns set in a better known and more marketable area, thus succeeding in increasing her sales and in improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a showcase, computer cases, equipment, charges and screensavers for her activity.

loans.name: Adriano De Jesús

texts.es: Adriano, a sus 37 años de edad es soltero y no tiene hijos, toda su vida ha vivido en el campo y allí se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, actividad con la que ha obtenido recursos para el sustento diario de su familia. “La agricultura ha sido muy golpeada, nos vemos afectados por la guerrilla, por las vacunas o por el clima y esto hace que la agricultura sea una actividad muy incierta” con estas palabras Adriano manifiesta su preocupación por la difícil situación a la que se exponen en el campo. Es por ello que se ve motivado a solicitar su primer crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en el montaje de un negocio de comidas rápidas, para lo cual ya tomó en arriendo un local, y necesita comprar silletería y mesas, insumos para hacer los alimentos (frutas, verduras, carne, gaseosas) y herramientas de trabajo (licuadoras, utensilios de cocina) para comenzar a atender a sus clientes y ofrecerles buena calidad en los productos. Para este proyecto contará con el apoyo de un familiar que ya tiene experiencia en preparación y venta de comidas rápidas, quien lo orientará y le enseñará todo lo relacionado con esta actividad. De esta manera, Adriano pretende cumplir uno de sus principales sueños, tener un negocio grande y organizado, que le permita ser reconocido en el sector y de esta forma generar ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida, complementando con la agricultura.
texts.en: Adriano is 37 years old, he is single and has no children. He has spent all of his life in the country, where he has been engaging in farming since he was very young, and thanks to this activity he has earned an income to daily support his family. “Farming has been deeply hit and affected by guerilla, vaccines and by the weather, and this makes of agriculture a very uncertain activity”: with these words Adriano shows his concern for the difficult situation people are subject to in the fields. For this reason he has decided to ask for his first loan, and he will use it to set up a fast-food activity. He has already rented a locale and he needs to buy chairs and tables, ingredients to prepare food (fruit, vegetables, meat, fizzy drinks) and working tools (blenders, kitchen tools) to start tending to his customers and to offer them good quality products. He will get support for this project form a relative who is already experienced in preparing and selling fast foods, and who will guide him and teach him everything related to this activity. This is how Adriano hopes to make one of his biggest dreams come true: owing and managing a big shop that will help him being well-known in his trade area, in order to improve his standard of living by earning an extra income that will complement the one from his farming activity.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, blenders, kitchen tools, fruits, vegetables, meat and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
Cherrylyn is 31 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, distilled water, sugar, oil, onions, ginger, garlic, groceries, etc. to sell.

Cherrylyn has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from boarding house rental and raising pigs.

Cherrylyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, distilled water, sugar, oil, onions, ginger, garlic, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sreychan's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Cheuny Prey district, Sreychan is aged 30 years and married with three dependent children. Two of the children are in school, while another one is too young for school. To make a living and support her family, Sreychan and her husband have been farming rice as their primary business for ten years and she supplements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her KHR 23,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.  

This is the first micro loan for Sreychan’s group of four with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 37 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Dina has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from food vending and buying and selling nipa (palm leaves) roofing.

Dina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Sokcheang's Group

texts.en:
Sokcheang is aged 34 years and is widowed with two children. She lives in a rural village of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district. She earns a living through farming rice and selling grocery items, which she has been doing for twelve years. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Sokcheang has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sokcheang successfully used the first loan to better support her children and increase her family’s business. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Heak's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Heak is aged 48 years and married. She has nine children, two of whom are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for several years, and they supplement the family’s income by making palm juice. The current business earns them about 20,000 KHR per day, and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the fourth microloan for Heak with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her make her living better. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. 

With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living and send and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Sarat is a 21-year-old married woman. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day, but she can manage to save about 13,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sarat is a first-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy pesticides, fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business and also hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Donnabel

texts.en:
Donabel is a hardworking entrepreneur who buy and sells crabs, lobsters and shrimp in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now requests an additional loan to purchase additional seafood to sell.

Donabel has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  

She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sea food to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel lives in Manla, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is 40 years old, married with six children. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him by selling fresh fish in the community to earn a living. She joined GDMPC in 2010 and she gained access to microfinance services. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP in order to buy nets and to repair the fishing boat. She hopes to save a portion of her income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy nets and to repair fishing boat

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 64 year-old resident of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. 

She supported her two children's needs through her gardening business that she has run for the past 20 years.  She earns about 5,000 PHP per month.  Julieta also harvests coconuts and bananas to improve her life.  

In 2010 Julieta became a member of GDMPC and recently she applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer.  Julieta wants to cultivate her farm and able to generate more income to ensure a better life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta, 59 years old,  is a widow with 3 children. For more than  3 years, she has managed a banana and coconut farm, earning a monthly income of PHP 4,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Antonieta hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 42 years old and married with seven children, three attend school.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines.  Emelda is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelda has raised pigs for seven years and earns additional income as a fish vendor.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is requesting a loan of $ 600 to improve her business.  She runs a kiosk to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy a variety of items to resell including slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk two year ago with her own working capital of $ 500.  

Filomena is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy supplies for her kiosk.

loans.name: Felisidad

texts.en:
Felisidad works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

Felisidad requests a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables like beans, onions, garlic, tomatoes, squash, etc to sell.

Felisidad has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Felisidad would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables like beans, onions, garlic, tomatoes, squash, etc to sell.

loans.name: Nelly Del Socorro

texts.es: Nelly es una señora de 54 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la confección y elaboración de tejidos en crochet, actividad que aprendió por herencia de su madre que era modista, además alterna esta actividad con la venta de la mercancía y accesorios, con lo cual ha obtenido ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella ha vivido una situación económica muy difícil, pues no tuvo el apoyo del padre de sus hijos y toda la carga la tuvo que soportar ella, sin embargo, con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y entrega ha trabajado arduamente para sacarlos adelante sola. Nelly busca apoyo con un crédito que solicita, para invertirlo en la compra de materiales y mercancía (cadenas, aretes, anillos, hilos, tela, agujas) para continuar realizando sus tejidos y tener más variedad de accesorios para ofrecerle a  sus clientes y poder incrementar sus ingresos. Doña Nelly sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y tener más clientes, aumentar sus ventas y así brindarle bienestar y mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly is a 54 year-old woman who is single and has 3 children.  She currently has a business making crocheted items.  She learned to crochet from her mother, who was a dressmaker.  In addition to this activity, she also sells merchandise and accessories, which has enabled her to obtain income to provide for her children and support the household.  Nelly has experienced economic hardship in her life, as she has not had financial support from the father of her children.  She has had to bear the entire burden of supporting them herself.  However, with a lot of effort, commitment and dedication, she has worked arduously to get ahead on her own.  

Nelly is seeking support in the form of a loan that will allow her to invest in the purchase of supplies and merchandise (chains, earrings, rings, fabric, thread and needles) so that she can continue to do her crochet work and have a variety of accessories to offer to her customers, thereby increasing her income.  Nelly dreams of growing her business, having more customers, and increasing her sales, so that she can provide for her family's welfare and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and merchandise (chains, earrings, rings, fabric, thread and needles)

loans.name: Elviana

texts.en: Elviana is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk two years ago with her own working capital of $500. Elviana is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Luzcilda

texts.en:
Luzcilda is married and is a 30-year-old mother of three children. She lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental where she runs a 'buy and sell' business to earn a living. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver and she helps him generate income with her 'nipa'  (woven palm frond mats used for house walls) 'buy and sell' business. 

Luzcilda took out a loan from GDMPC microcredit in order to buy more 'nipa' for sale. She hopes to earn more income to be used for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more woven 'nipa' for sale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk two years ago with her own working capital of $500.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits

loans.name: Alinia

texts.en: Alinia, 43 years old, is married and blessed with four children. She's been in the vegetable sales business for almost 5 years. She earns for a living by selling some dinner dishes and has a net income of Php 400 per week. She has decided to request a loan amounting of Php 17,000 to purchase food ingredients, condiments, and other needed materials for her food business. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize it for her business to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, condiments, and other needed materials for her food business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a married woman with one child. Maricel is 30 years old, and comes from Calamba, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. Maricel raises pigs for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for more than five years. Aside from this, she also has a farm of coconut and fruit trees, harvesting the fruit for sale. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer and cover the cost of weeding maintenance. In the future, Maricel wants to make improvements on her house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover the cost of weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married and lives in Calamba Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband works as a technician, their main source of income, and she helps him for a living by managing her 'sari sari' store and refreshment stand. 

Merlyn joined GDMPC in 2012 and she is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP in order to repair the shelter for her goods and buy more ingredients and assorted snacks for sale. She hopes that her savings from a portion of her income will help cover her children's education costs in the future.

loans.use: to repair the shelter for her goods and buy more ingredients and assorted snacks for sale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: A $600.00 loan is being offered to Jacinta to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and a refrigerator to keep drinks. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and a refrigerator to keep drinks.

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lutgarda works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lutgarda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Lutgarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 57 years old and widowed with eight children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nida is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Nida has been farming rice for seven years and also earns additional income from a tricycle transport business. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell-vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and a general store. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell-vegetables business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Brimlee

texts.en:
Ma. Brimlee is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Ma. Brimlee has been in this business for five years. Ma. Brimlee earns more income from buying and selling charcoal. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further develop her fishing and 'buy and sell' charcoal businesses.

Ma. Brimlee has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en: Valeriana is a 52-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has three children ages 23, 18 and 6 years old.She runs a 'sari-sari' (variety) store. She sells various items like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, seasonings and soft drinks. She has been operating a retail store for more than 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more various goods like soft drinks, condiments, and  toiletries to have additional stock to avoid shortages. In the future, Valeriana would like to improve her variety store to have a sustainable livelihood and to be able to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more various goods like soft drinks, condiments, and  toiletries

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is taking out a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2001 with her own working capital of $700. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
As the widowed parent of five children, Florife works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from prepaid mobile load. Florife is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional soap, milk, spices, canned goods, noodles and other items to sell. 

Florife has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional soap, milk, spices, canned goods, noodles and other items to sell.

loans.name: Nicolás Alirio

texts.es: Nicolás es un hombre de 48 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la marquetería, actividad que conoció cuando era joven y laboraba en un taller que prestaba este servicio; además también tiene conocimiento sobre fotografía y hace pintura al óleo, con lo cual ha podido generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. El local donde presta el servicio es subarrendado y eso hace que las ganancias que obtiene por las ventas, se reduzcan, por lo tanto dificulta la estabilidad económica del hogar. Él es un señor emprendedor, juicioso y entregado a su familia y a su trabajo; es por eso que busca apoyo con el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina pulidora, un compresor, molduras y pinturas, para continuar con su negocio y poder ofrecer un producto bien elaborado y pulido que satisfaga la necesidad de cada cliente y así aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos. El señor Nicolás sueña con tener su negocio en un local propio y tener muchos más clientes que reconozcan su labor y lo recomienden a otras personas, porque así se ahorraría el pago del arriendo y ese dinero lo invertiría en su negocio y en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Nicolás is 48 years old.  He is married and has 2 children.  He makes frames, an activity that he learned when he was young and worked in a shop that provided this service.  He also knows about photography and does oil painting, which has enabled him to earn money to support his family.   He sublets the space where he has his business, which reduces the earnings he makes on each sale and complicates his family's financial stability.  He is an entrepreneurial man, wise and dedicated to his family and his work.  For this reason he is requesting a loan which he will invest in a sander, a compressor, molding, and paintings, in order to continue with his business and offer a well-made and sanded product that meets the needs of each of his clients, so he can increase his sales and earnings.   Nicolás dreams of having his own space for his business and of having many more customers who recognize him for his work and recommend him to others.  He will save money by not having to pay rent, and he will invest his money in the business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy molding, paint, a sander, and compressor.

loans.name: Ignacio José

texts.es: Ignacio es un hombre de 53 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y tiene una hija de  16 años. Toda su infancia la vivió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas, pero hace 20 años, por cuestiones de violencia y falta de oportunidades de empleo, decidió trasladarse para otro municipio, en busca de nuevas oportunidades para salir adelante. Se dedicó a la venta ambulante, ofreciendo diversos productos como plátano, ñame, yuca, sandía entre otros, con esto ha generado ingresos para el sustento diario de su familia. Ignacio es trabajador y responsable, a pesar de las dificultades económicas siempre lucha para sacar a su familia adelante, por eso solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito, que desea invertir en compra de surtido al por mayor (plátano, yuca, sandía, ñame, papa, mango) y aprovechar los descuentos que le hacen, para poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y generar más ingresos, ya que desea cumplir el sueño de brindarle educación superior a su hija para que sea una gran profesional y así mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Ignacio is a 53-year-old man who is in a civil union with his spouse and has a 16-year-old daughter.  All of his childhood, he lived on farms, where he learned agricultural work.  However, 20 years ago due to violence issues and lack of job opportunities, he decided to move to another municipality in search of new opportunities to move forward.  He made a living as a street vendor, offering different products such as plantains, yams, yuca and watermelon, among others. With this, he has generated income to support his family daily.

Ignacio is a hard-worker and is responsible. In spite of economic hardships, he always fights to move his family forward.  He therefore is asking for a second round of loans.  He wishes to invest in purchasing a larger quantity of products (plantains, yuca, watermelon, yams, potatoes, mangos) and take advantage of the discounts.  He will be able to offer a wider variety to his customers and generate more income. He wishes to fulfill his dream of providing his daughter a higher education so that she can be a great professional and also improve the quality of life for all the family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of products (plantains, yuca, watermelon, yams, potato and mango)

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La socia Brígida continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura”, la socia sigue dedicándose a la  venta de verduras y a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan,la socia es una persona responsable y desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes para su negocio.

Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Brígida is still a member of the “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” communal bank, and she continues to sell vegetables and raise small animals. She then sells the animals to customers who ask her for them. Brigida is a responsible person and wants to continue working in this way to support her family.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy guinea pigs for her business. She is pleased with the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is married with three children and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. His wife is a teacher and he operates a service-based business providing motor transportation in the community. He borrowed a loan of 10,000.00 PHP from GDMPC micro credit in order to cover the costs of motor repair and maintenance. He plans to acquire another motorcycle to be used for business expansion.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motor repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco es un hombre con 57 años de edad, es soltero y nunca tuvo hijos. Durante mucho tiempo se dedicó a ejercer la profesión de químico farmacéutico en varias empresas y, cuando terminó su contrato de trabajo decidió independizarse y montar su negocio, una distribuidora de tortas, piñatería, productos desechables y helados, con el cual lleva 14 años en el mercado. Él es organizado y muy trabajador, abre su negocio a las 10:00 de la mañana y lo cierra a las 8:30 de la noche, para aprovechar la ventaja de ser reconocido en el sector donde se encuentra ubicado. Francisco solicita el crédito para comprar surtido de tortas para ofrecer más variedad a su clientes en las temporadas especiales que se aproximan y, de esta forma incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos para su sustento diario, además desea ahorrar para cumplir su principal sueño, que es montar otro punto de venta en un sector reconocido y más comercial, que le permita ofrecer oportunidades de empleo y mejorar su calidad de vida con una buena estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Francisco is 57 years old.  He is single and never had children.  For many years, he worked as a pharmaceutical chemist for various companies.  When his work contracted ended, he decided to work for himself.  He started his own business as a distributor of cakes, party supplies, paper products and ice creams 14 years ago.  He is organized and a very hard worker.  He opens his business at 10am and closes at 8:30pm and takes advantage of being known in the area where his shop is located.  Francisco is requesting a loan to purchase a selection of cakes to offer greater variety to his customers during the upcoming holidays, and in this way he will increase his sales and income to support himself.  He also wants to save money to achieve his main goal, which is to open another shop in a well-known and more commercial area.  This would allow him to offer employee opportunities and improve his quality of life with good financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase a selection of cakes.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell wood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. Joy is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional wood to sell for her buy-and-sell wood business.

Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional wood to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura”, la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelanté a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zanahorias y cebollas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the "Virgen Purificada de Angostura" communal bank and is continuing to sell vegetables in one of the popular markets of the enchanting city of Cusco. She has had this business for some years now and it is going well, thanks to her determination she gives every day to her business as this is how she is meeting her family's needs. 

Celia needs this loan to buy carrots and onions for her business. 
She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy carrots and onions for her business.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: Luis, a sus 44 años de edad, es un hombre casado y padre de 4 hijos. Ha tenido experiencia laboral en el área de la construcción y la vigilancia, pero hace 17 años, cuando se le terminó su último contrato de trabajo, él decidió independizarse, gracias a los consejos de un amigo que se dedicaba a las ventas ambulantes.  Él comenzó vendiendo aguacates y frutas y ahora también ofrece pescado. Gracias a esta actividad, ha podido obtener ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, porque es un hombre trabajador, con ganas de salir adelante y cada día sale a vender sus productos desde las 4:30 de la mañana hasta las 2:30 de la tarde, horario que disfruta mucho porque además de trabajar, le queda tiempo para encargarse de su hogar y del cuidado de sus hijos. Luis sabe que debe seguir luchando por su familia, por eso solicita apoyo con el crédito que desea invertir en la compra neveras portátiles y de pescados y frutas al por mayor, para poder aprovechar los descuentos que le hacen y así tener productos frescos con variedad disponible para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes. Como todas las personas, Luis también desea hacer realidad sus sueños, especialmente ahorrar para montar una pesquera en un local propio, que le permita ofrecer oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Luis is 44 years old.  He is married and has 4 children.  He has worked in construction and security, but 17 years ago when his last work contract ended, he decided to work for himself, thanks to advice from a friend who worked as a street vendor.  He began selling avocados and fruit, and now he also sells fish.  Thanks to this work, he has been able to earn money to support his family.  He is a hard worker, with a desire to succeed.  He goes out to sell his products starting at 4:30 in the morning and works until 2:30pm.  He likes this schedule very much because besides in addition to work, he has time to take care of his home and care for his children. Luis knows he needs to keep fighting for his family, so for this reason he is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of portable coolers and wholesale fish and fruit, in order to take advantage of the discounts they offer.  In this way he will have a variety of fresh products available to meet the needs and tastes of his customers.  Like everyone, Luis also wants to make his dreams a reality.  In particular, he wants to save money to set up his own fish shop, which would enable him to offer employment opportunities and to improve the quality of life of his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase portable coolers and wholesale inventory (fish and fruit).

loans.name: Emma Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Emma se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y tambien al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m en le negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Member Emma continues making a living off the agricultural business and business of selling basic goods.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. in the business of selling basic goods.  Her dream is to have a small grocery store.  She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil to start her small grocery store. 

She’s happy about the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil to start her small grocery store.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La socia Filomena se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia vende arroz, azucar, leche, aceite y galletas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que quiere salir adelante , el sueño de la socia es ampliar y tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de primera necesidad. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Filomena continues to be a member of the “Virgen Purificada de Angostura” and sells primary needs products such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, bread, cooking oil, and cookies. She is an enterprising woman who wants to be successful.  Her dream is to expand and have a locale where she can sell her basic needs products. She seeks a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies at wholesale. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale.

loans.name: Atilano Emilio

texts.es: Emilio tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de mercancía como relojes, perfumes, planchas para el cabello, bafles, entre otros, actividad con la cual ha obtenido ingresos para llevar la carga económica en su hogar. Él es un hombre emprendedor y dedicado, pero la falta de recursos económicos lo ha llevado a vivir situaciones difíciles, sin embargo, esto no lo detiene para seguir luchando por lo que quiere y su motivación inicial son sus hijos, por ello solicita el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de surtido de mercancía (perfumería, relojes, planchas y secadores para el cabello, accesorios electrónicos) con el fin de ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y conseguir el dinero suficiente para llevar el sustento a su familia. Emilio sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, incrementando las ventas, para poder ahorrar y comprar una casa propia para ofrecerle a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida y una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Emilio is 47 years old.  He lives with his wife and their two children.  For the past 15 years he has sold merchandise such as watches, perfumes, hair irons, speakers, etc., which has provided him with income to support his family.  He is hard-working and dedicated, but a lack of financial resources has put him through difficult situations.  Nevertheless, this doesn't stop him from continuing to fight for what he loves, and his children are his main motivation.  He is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of merchandise (perfumes, watches, hair irons and hair dryers, electronic accessories) with the goal of offering more selection to his customers and obtaining enough money to support his family.  Emilio dreams of growing his business and increasing sales so that he can save money to purchase a home in order to offer his family more wellbeing, a better quality of life, and a good education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase inventory (perfumes, watches, hair irons and hair dryers, electronic accessories).

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio es padre soltero, vive con su hija en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. Rogelio tiene trabajo en un laboratorio, aunque su profesion es odontología. El credito lo necesita para pagar el costo de su segundo año de maestría. Rogelio desea mejorar sus ingresos y para eso debe estar mas capacitado en el mercado laboral.

Es la primera vez que acude a IMPRO y es su primer prestamo con Kiva.
texts.en: Rogelio is a single father.  He lives with his daughter in his parents' house which is located in the city of La Paz.  Rogelio works in a laboratory even though his profession is dentistry.   He needs this loan to pay for the second year of his master's degree.  Rogelio wants to increase his income and to do so he needs to have more training for the labor market.  This is the first time he has requested assistance from IMPRO and this is his first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for his second year of Master's studies.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La socia Zoila se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia prepara distintos tipos de comida, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, él sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para preparar la comida como pollo, carne y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Zoila continues with her business selling food; she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner, She prepares various types of food. She works from 10:00 AM until 8:00 PM so that her business will be sucessful. She dreams of having a restaurant. She seeks a loan to buy ingredients to prepare her food such as chicken, beef, and vegetables. Zoila is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to prepare food such as chicken, beef, and vegetables.

loans.name: Ruth Delia

texts.es:
La socia Ruth Delia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como trigo, cebada y tarwi y también la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras como zapallos, tomates, cebollas y zanahorias, la socia en sus negocios tiene 7 años y   le va muy bien, la socia por medios de estos pequeños negocios quiere salir adelante, él sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras y los granos secos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras como zapallos, cebollas y zanahorias.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Ruth Delia still works in the business of selling dried grains such as wheat, barley, and  tarwi. She also continues to work in the business of selling vegetables such as squash, tomatoes, onions, and carrots. She has had her businesses for 7 years and it is going very well for her. Through these small businesses she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to have a locale where she she can sell vegetables and the dried grains. She is asking for the loan to buy vegetables such as squash, onions and carrots. 

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as squash, onions, and carrots.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
La socia Yessica continúa con el  banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura”,la socia seguir dedicándose a la venta de comida (Desayuno, almuerzo y cenas),la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia es una persona empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite, papas entre otros insumos para su restaurante.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito  y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Yessica continues to belong to the "Virgen Purificada de Angostura" communal bank. She still sells meals (breakfast, lunch and supper). She wants to continue working in this way to support her family. Yessica is a persevering individual and she works to get her family ahead. She needs this loan to buy rice, oil, potatoes as well as other supplies for her restaurant. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the installment payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, potatoes and other supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Yelina

texts.es:
La socia Yelina pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura”. 

La socia continua con dedicándose a su negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Yelina belongs to the communal bank “Virgen Purificada de Angostura”. She continues to work raising small animals such as chickens. She raises the animals to then sell them to her customers. She wises to continue working in order to support her family, as this is the way to secure her family's future. 

Yelina is requesting this loan to buy chickens for her business. 

She is grateful for the loan and she promises to make the related payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business

loans.name: Yadira Simelanea

texts.es: La cliente es de la zona de Suburbio en Guayaquil.   Empezó vendiendo ropa por catálogo, para luego emprender en la venta de Yanbal y Avon.  Ahora también está comercializando Omnilife y junto con sus otras actividades, se ayuda en la manutención de sus hijos.  Sale a recorrer los sectores en busca de clientes todos los días, generalmente en la tarde.  Es separada y tiene 4 hijos, quienes estudian en la escuela y colegio fiscal.  Necesita invertir el dinero en mercadería (cosméticos y artículos de belleza) para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the area of Suburbio in Guayaquil. She started out selling clothes through catalogs, but later began selling Yanbal and Avon products. She now also sells Omnilife products.
