Through all of these business activities, the borrower is able to support her children. She travels every day through the neighborhoods in search of customers, generally in the afternoons.

The borrower is separated from her spouse and has four children who are studying at state schools at either the elementary or high school level. She needs to invest the money from her loan in merchandise (cosmetics and beauty products) for her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita lives in Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, with her two children. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him through her buy-and-sell business selling crabs, shrimp and fish in the market. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit in order to buy additional fish, shrimp and crabs for sale. She plans to use the generated income for the renovation of her house.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, shrimp and crabs for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old, married and blessed with two children. Even though her children are still young, she wants to work hard to save money for her children's education.

Helen has a sari-sari, or a small general store, from which she sells grocery items, vegetables and meat. She has been in business for five years and hopes to see the shop prosper while she manages it.

Helen is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy extra vegetables, chicken, fish, pork and grocery items to sell. She hopes to grow her business and make more in profits with an eye to her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, fish, pork and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in the town of CPG, Bohol. For more than ten years now she and her husband have fished and sold their catch to make a living.

Nida is applying for a 17,000 PHP loan through CEVI to be used to help her buy a new fishing boat. With this her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Especasion

texts.en:
Especasion is 51 years old and married with three children. She has been farming rice for five years in the Philippines and earns extra income by fattening and selling pigs.

Especasion is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy insecticides, pesticides and other supplies for her farm. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, pesticides and other supplies for her farm

loans.name: Julio Alfredo

texts.es:
Julio tiene 61 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Aprendió a trabajar  en la tierra desde los 12 años de edad, a sus 61 todavía sigue trabajando en la agricultura y en la crianza de ganado. Narra don Julio que antes también trabajaron en las algodoneras donde les pagaban el jornal.

Compra sus insumos y materiales en un municipio, donde tiene que trasladarlos en camión o en su carreta a una distancia de dos kilómetros.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes y otros insumos para 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz que tiene sembradas actualmente.

Con la inversión, podrá darle el manejo a su cultivo, pudiendo así garantizar al final de su producción la alimentación de su familia y obtención de ingresos para otras necesidades que se le presenten con la venta de excedentes de cosecha.

Su propósito es, ver crecer a sus nietos con las oportunidades que él y sus hijos no pudieron tener por la pobreza en que Vivían y seguir cultivando su tierra.
texts.en:
Julio is 61 years old, has a common-law spouse, and two children. He learned to work on the land when he was 12 years old, and at 61 he is still working in agriculture and raising livestock. 

Julio says that before, he also worked in the cotton business where they paid wages. He buys his supplies and materials in a town, and he has to transport them by truck or in his wagon for a distance of two kilometres. 

The loan he is applying for from Fundación Campo, is to buy fertilizers and other supplies for 14,000 square metres of currently sown cornfields. With the investment, he will be able to manage his crop and so, at the end of production, be able to guarantee food for his family and income for other necessities that come up with the sale of the harvest surplus.

His intention is to see his grandchildren grow up with the opportunities that he and his children could not have because of the poverty in which they lived, and to continue cultivating his land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for 14,000 square metres of currently sown cornfields

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with five children and lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental province in the Philippines. For the past six years Susan has managed the family coconut and banana business. Every month she earns about 8,000 PHP from her trees.

Susan also has a store to bring in extra money to help with the family's basic needs. In order to buy canned goods, milk, sugar and other groceries to sell, she is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through GDMPC.

Susan’s ambition is to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, sugar and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOGOTIERI, un des villages de la commune de ZANGARADOUGOU dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   AFOU   debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 145.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "BENKADI III" are married women, who average 44 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in BOGOTIERI, a village in Commune de ZANGARADOUGOU, in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali: SIKASSO. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with AFOU, who is standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing and fertilizer to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in villages and in SIKASSO. She plans on making a profit of 145,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a 30-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children aged one and eight years.

For the past two years Sheila has cooked and sold meals like stew with vegetables, fried fish, meat soups and other native foods. She is applying for a loan of 4000 PHP through CEVI to buy more ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables, fish and seasonings to make and sell her dishes to her customers.

Sheila would like to expand her business so she can pay her weekly dues and provide her children with nutritious food and good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make the dishes she sells.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, 47, is married with two children and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental province. She owns and manages a sari-sari, or small general store, in town from which she sells groceries to make a living.

Emma recently joined GDMPC and has applied for a 5,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy additional rice and corn grits to sell. She hopes to support her children in school and see them finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is 18 while the youngest is 1 year old. She engages in a food vending business. She cooks homemade meals like fried chicken and stewed vegetables, and she also makes ice candy to bring in more income. Her husband works as a private driver. She has been doing her food vending business for more than five years now. 

To be able to finance her food vending business, Alma requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos to buy more ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and seasonings. She wants to continue to serve her customers and to be able also to maintain her capital.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and  seasonings

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOGOTIERI, un des villages de la commune de ZANGARADOUGOU dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   BINTOU   debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences, payer frais de labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 140.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "BENKADI II" are married women, who average 45 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in BOGOTIERI, a village in Commune de ZANGARADOUGOU, in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali: SIKASSO. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with BINTOU, who is standing second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for seeds, plowing, and fertilizer to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in villages and in SIKASSO. She plans on making a profit of 140,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing

loans.name: Jhovy

texts.en:
Jhovy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from a general store.

Jhovy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 26,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha est conseillère du collectif d’affaire  «Heshima», femme entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un chômeur. La cliente est vendeuse des planches. Elle s’entraide dans cette entreprise avec son mari. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 4 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 100 planches. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: This client, Furaha, is the advisor of the business collective "Heshima". An experience woman entrepreneur, she is 50 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, all in school. Her husband is unemployed. This client sells boards (lumber). She is assisted in this enterprise by her husband. She started her business with her own funds received from her husband about four years ago. This new loan will be used to purchase 100 boards. Thus, she would like to grow her business, providing schooling and food for her children, and build a house. In closing, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support for small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 100 planks

loans.name: Bénédiction Group

texts.fr: La cliente Balibonera est conseillère du collectif d’affaire  «Bénédiction»,  jeune femme entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un infirmier. La cliente est sociétaire d’une officine pharmaceutique. Elle s’entraide dans cette entreprise avec son mari. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 4 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les médicaments essentiels (paracétamol, anti biotiques, anti inflammatoires, vermifuges, pommades, seringues, etc.).  Les taxes et tracasseries administratives sont des obstacles pour son entreprise. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes détiennent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Balibonera, is the advisor of the business collective "Bénédiction". A young experience woman entrepreneur, she is 30 years old, married, and the mother of five children, all in school. Her husband is a nurse. This client is an associate in a pharmacy. She is assisted in this enterprise by her husband. She started this work with her own funds received from her husband about four years ago. 

This new loan will be used to purchase essential medicines (paracétamol, anti-biotics, anti-inflammatories, deworming drugs, ointments, syringes, etc.) Some obstacles for her enterprise include taxes and administrative red tape. 

Thus, she would like to grow her business, providing schooling and food for her children, and build a house. In closing, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support for small-scale entrepreneurs. It should be noted that certain clients in the photo are holding their babies.

loans.use: to purchase essential medicines (paracétamol, anti-biotics, anti-inflammatories, deworming drugs, ointments, syringes, etc.)

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi vit avec son enfant de 04ans à Lomé. En 2004, elle a démarré la vente des produits cosmétiques au marché et s'approvisionne à Lomé chez les grossistes. Manquant de fonds pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle fait son troisième prêt à WAGES pour approvisionner en marchandises. Le profit tiré de la vente l'aidera à réinvestir dans l'activité et à permettre à la famille de s'épanouir. Elle est âgée de 31ans.
texts.en: Afi lives with her 4-year-old child in Lomé. In 2004, she got started selling cosmetic products at the market. She gets her supplies in Lomé from wholesalers. Lacking funds to respond better to the needs of her customer, she is applying for her third WAGES loan for supplies of merchandise. The profit earned from the sales will help her to reinvest in her business and enable her family to thrive. She is 31 years old.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mercedita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. NWTF is listing Mercedita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As the married mother of eight children, Melanie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and fattening pigs.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 22,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Emily works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruit in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Emily is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall. 

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel is a hard-working entrepreneur who buys and sells crabs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Marcel earns additional income from selling fish.  

Marcel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her crab and fish business. Marcel is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional crabs to sell.

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs to sell

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en:
Olinda runs a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to turn it into a bigger business, but she does not have enough working capital. 

Olinda is taking a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin (TRM). She feels better having applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional stock to keep in her store, such as t-shirts, blouses, shorts and pants. She is happy with TRM, which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, shorts, and pants

loans.name: Verónica Raquel

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer de 28 años de edad, acompañada y con dos hijos. Aprendió a trabajar con animales desde muy niña, su abuelo le enseño también trabajar la milpa, ya que su papá los abandonó cuando estaban muy pequeños a ella y a sus hermanos. Con ganado propio ha trabajado desde hace seis años con su compañero de vida; además posee una crianza y engorde de cerdos para obtener otros ingresos que le ayuden a brindar el estudio a sus hijos y cubrir otras necesidades. A pesar de su corta edad, Verónica tiene muchas ganas de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, tendiendo iniciativas productivas buscando la manera que le permitan obtener ingresos para su familia. El hecho de que quiera sacar un crédito para hacer posible su iniciativa demuestra lo emprendedora que es.

Ella compra el concentrado a 6 kilómetros de su vivienda. Paga para que le trasladen sus materiales e insumos  en camiones que hay en el cantón,  también busca rastrojos de maíz o maicillo que dejan  los agricultores de la zona y otros materiales para alimentar a sus vaquitas  y así reducir los costos de producción.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  tres terneros y  engordarlos  aprovechando la época lluviosa, donde abunda el pasto para alimentarlos y venderlos a mejor precio, a fin de obtener un pequeño ingreso extra para su familia.

Lo que pretende es, disponer  con el dinero, para aprovechar  la oportunidad (época lluviosa), donde puede engordar ganado reduciendo costos de inversión y cubrir necesidades básicas para sus hijos.

Desea a futuro  ampliar su cantidad de ganado, que le permita asegurarle el estudio a sus hijos, que puedan llegar a  la universidad, ya que ella no pudo cursar mas que su tercer grado, por el hecho de tener que ayudarle a su abuelo a trabajar desde muy pequeña dejando su estudio y futuro con mejores oportunidades en segundo plano.
texts.en:
Verónica is 28 years old, has a partner and two children. She learned to work with animals as a child and her grandfather taught her how to grow corn. Her father abandoned her and her brothers when she was very young. For the last six years she and her life partner have been raising their own livestock. She also breeds and fattens pigs to make more money to help their children's studies and pay other expenses. In spite of her young age Veronica has a strong desire to improve her living standard, taking the initiative to find ways to make income for her family. The reason that she wants this loan demonstrates how enterprising she is.

She buys concentrated feed 6 kilometers from her home. She pays local trucks to transport the goods. She also looks for corn and sorghum waste that farmers in the area leave to feed her cattle, thus reducing her production costs. 

She will use this loan from Fundacion Campo to buy three calves, taking advantage of the rainy season with it's abundant grasses to fatten them. She will sell them at a profit in order to make a little more money for her family. What she wants to do with the money from the loan is to take advantage of the opportunity (the rainy season) when she can fatten cattle with less expenses and pay for the basic necessities for her children.

In the future she would like to have more cattle, which would allow her children to study until university. She couldn't study past Grade 3 as she had to work to help her grandfather. So at a very young age she had to leave her studies and a brighter future behind.

loans.use: to buy three calves to fatten during the rainy season.

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento MUJERES EN VICTORIA está  compuesto por diez integrantes, nueve mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Sofia en la foto la de la chompa roja y el gorrito rojo tiene 47 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 7 y 14 que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de asaditos en su pensión se encuentra en la zona de Tres Pasos,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sofia va a usar este préstamo para compra mesas y sillas , su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra esta herramienta útil para su negocio ya que así brindará comodidad a su clientela,  la Sra. Sofia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida rápida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar su sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de la misma para poder captar más clientes, la Sra. Sofia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
This communal bank, 'Mujeres en Victoria' (Women in Victory), has ten members, nine women and one man. The president of the bank is 47-year-old Sofia. In the photo she is wearing a red sweater and cap. Sofia has two school-age children aged 7 and 14, and has a business selling grilled foods from her premises in the Tres Pasos area.

This loan is Sofia's first cycle with the institution, and she will use it to purchase tables and chairs for her stall. The reason that Sofia applied for this loan was that she did not have the capital required to buy these useful items for her business, which will provide comfort for her customers. 

The challenge Sofia faces in her business is competition from other fast food businesses, and she has to try to reduce her expenses while improving the flavor of her dishes. She will use her profits to purchase utensils and also expand her business to attract more customers.  

Sofia is a very hardworking person, and she is happy to be able to receive the opportunity given to her through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her food stall

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 58 años de edad, es casado. Aprendió a trabajar con su papá, el junto con sus dos hermanas y tres hermanos trabajaban con su padre. Siendo el mayor de sus hermanos tuvo que sacrificar  su juventud para apoyar a su padre comenzó a trabajar a los 7 años.

Siempre ha trabajado la agricultura; hoy en día con su esposa  además de cultivar  se dedican a la crianza y engorde de ganado, en la actualidad cuentan con un par de bueyes, también por el bajo precio que le compran sus productos agrícolas buscan compensar  recogiendo y vendiendo leña para obtener pequeños ingresos.

Los insumos agrícolas los compra en una comunidad y los traslada en camión para su casa, este le cobra el transporte. Don pedro analiza la situación de precios: precios elevados en insumos y bajos a la hora de vender sus productos; pero sabe que si no cultiva no  tendrá para alimentar a su familia el próximo año.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la inversión,  esperar tener el sustento de su familia el año venidero. 

Él quiere formar una asociación cooperativa, con pequeños agricultores para comercializar y tener poder de negociación en la venta de sus productos, ya que manifiesta que los compradores imponen sus precios y también gran parte de la ganancia queda en manos de intermediarios, y con necesidad hay que vender. Por eso piensa en esa alternativa.
texts.en:
Pedro is 58 years old and is married. He learned to work from his father; together with his two sisters and three brothers they used to work alongside their dad. As the eldest of the brothers he had to sacrifice his youth in order to help out, and started working at the age of 7.

He has always worked in agriculture. Currently, along with his wife, they not only grow plants but also raise and fatten livestock. They currently have a pair of oxen. Due to the low prices offered for their products, they have to look for a way to compensate, so they collect and sell firewood for another small source of income.

They buy their agricultural inputs in another community and bring them home in a truck that they pay for. Pedro's take on the price situation is that inputs are expensive and sales prices are down, but he knows that if he doesn't grow his crops he won't have any way to feed his family next year.

The loan that he requests from the Fundacion Campo is to buy fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides needed to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn. With the investment he hopes to be able to sustain his family in the coming year. 

He wants to form a cooperative association with other small farmers, so that they can have negotiating power when they sell their products. The buyers  impose their prices on them and a large part of the profits ends up in the hands of middlemen, but they have to sell because they are in need. For this reason he thinks of a cooperative as an alternative.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pesticides and herbicides to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a 58-year-old married  man from Talibon, Bohol. He has nine grown children. He engages in a tuba (coconut wine) vending business. He has been into tuba vending for more than 20 years. He requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy materials for tuba like gallon jugs (for tuba storage) and tungog (for flavoring tuba and to give tuba its maroon color and bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation). In the future, Benjamin would like to expand his tuba vending business to be able to repair his house and to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy gallons (for tuba storage) and tungog (flavoring tuba)

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon is 42 years old and is married with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Corazon has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Corazon requested a PHP 150,00 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Corazon has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ma. Corazon would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es una mujer de 49 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la confección, actividad que realiza hace aproximadamente 25 años, en el año 1994 inició su propio taller, generando 2 empleos fijos; gracias a esto y al apoyo de su esposo ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Es una persona trabajadora y dedicada, con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante su negocio, a pesar que los ingresos son inestables, porque en ciertas temporadas del año bajan las ventas. Ya ha tenido once ciclos de crédito con la Corporación y con el que solicita actualmente desea comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones) y realizará mantenimiento de las máquinas, con el fin de poder tener variedad que satisfaga los gustos de sus clientes y ofrecerles mejor calidad en el producto terminado. Su principal sueño es incrementar sus ingresos para poder adquirir una casa propia y ofrecer mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a la familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a 49-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two children. She currently works as a seamstress, a trade that she learned approximately 25 years ago. In 1994, she started her own workshop that generated two permanent jobs. Thanks to her business and the support of her husband, she has been able to help her children get ahead. Luz is a hardworking and dedicated person who has the drive to succeed in her business, despite having an unstable income due to certain times of the year when her sales are low.

Luz has already received 11 loans from Interactuar and her current request will be used to buy supplies in bulk (fabrics, thread, and buttons) and to pay for the maintenance of her machines. As a result, she will be able to offer a variety of goods to satisfy the tastes of her customers as well as provide better quality in her finished products. Her main goal is to increase her income so that she can acquire a house of her own and provide a better quality of life and the best well-being for her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies in bulk (fabrics, thread, and buttons) and to pay for the maintenance of her machines.

loans.name: Darma Sedana Group

texts.en:
After calculating and evaluating the last period, the Darma Sedana group decided to continue their loan. The loans were used to increase their pig business by purchasing new piglets and quality feed. 

Each person in the group received the same loan amount, each of them got 1,5M IDR.

Ni Ketut used her loan to purchase three super quality piglets for fattening. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovated the cage. She plans to sell the pigs near the holiday to gets a good price. She hopes her plan is running well. She and the group still need advice and loan support for their business until they are ready and have enough capital to continue the business by themselves.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 55 years old and married with four children.

Glenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs an ambulant vending business to sell household goods in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, etc.

Glenda has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ambulant vending of household goods business for four years and also earns an income from a welding shop.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Glenda aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a 32-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three school-aged children. She engages in seaweed farming to earn a living. She has been farming seaweed for almost five years now. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more seaweed seedlings, rope and tissue to increase the harvest. In the future, Rosalinda would like to expand her seaweed farming business to provide her children with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings, rope and tissue for her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Isla Trinitaria en Guayaquil.  Empezó hace 6 años en sociedad con su tío y escogió esta actividad porque es madre soltera.  Lamentablemente padece de una enfermedad terminal.  Tiene 2 hijos  que estudian en la escuela fiscal.  Aspira en un futuro a tener una camioneta propia para utilizarla en su negocio y también poder seguirle dando el estudio a sus hijos.  Invertirá el crédito en mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrwer is from the neighborhood of Isla Trinitaria in Guayaquil. She chose to partner with her uncle in this business six years ago because she is a single mother. Unfortunately, the borrower suffers from a terminal illness. She has two children who are studying at a state school.

In the future, the borrower aspires to have her own truck that she can use for her business. She also wants to provide for her children’s education. She will invest the loan in merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Chai

texts.en:
Chai is 28 years old, married and has three children. She lives with her spouse and children in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Since she settled down and has a family, she started growing rice for her family’s food and gradually expanded it into a business for profit. She can generate a net income of about KHR 14,600 per day from farming. 

She does not have a motorcycle for use in the family, so she has requested a loan to buy a motorbike for facilitating transportation. In the future, Chai intends to buy a few pieces of farmland to expand her rice growing and to start a retail business in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for facilitating transportation in her family.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: As a married parent of eight children, Lourdes works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to resell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia Antonia continúa con el  banco comunal “Virgen Purificada de Angostura”, la socia sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida y a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Antonia continues to be a member of the communal bank "Virgen Purificada de Angostura", and remains dedicated to her business where she sells food and staple goods. She is a responsible and earnest lady, and wants to be able to continue working in order to support her family. 

On this occasion, Antonia is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar and other staple items to stock her business.
She is grateful for the loan, and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and other items for her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell for her business. Maricel has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from raising pigs. Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 36 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to pay for farm laborers for land cultivation and to buy additional rice seeds for her farm. Mary Jane has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from her general store. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her farming rice and general store businesses. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for farm laborers for land cultivation and to buy additional rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es: Natividad de Jesús es una persona muy humilde y dedicada a su trabajo, es muy conocido por ser alguien responsable y trabajador quien siempre ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia, brindándoles todo lo necesario. Natividad de Jesús posee una venta de llantas usadas, con lo que puede suplirse de las necesidades básicas del hogar. Él solicita un préstamo,con el cual pueda tener la oportunidad de realizar mejoras en el hogar, principalmente en el servicio sanitario de su casa, el actual es de hoyo y poco higiénico en el cual debido a su estado deplorable necesita remplazar y construir un servicio sanitario de lavar, paredes de ladrillo y accesorios de baño, con techo de lamina Galvanizada, y tuberías PVC. La higiene y el uso adecuado de su sanitario es un factor muy importante para él y su familia, por lo que dicho préstamo será de mucha ayuda para suplir esta necesidad de modo que su familia pueda estar cómoda y feliz en su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Natividad de Jesús is a very humble man who is dedicated to his work. He is well known for being a responsible and hardworking person who has always fought hard to raise his family and provide them with everything they need. Natividad de Jesús has a business selling used tires, and he manages to cover his basic household needs with his income. 

He is applying for this loan in order to be able to make some improvements to his home, mainly in the bathroom which is currently unhygienic and in a deplorable condition. He wants to replace it and build a sanitary toilet with brick walls and bathroom accessories, with a galvanized metal roof and PVC pipes. Hygiene and proper healthcare is a very important to him and his family, and this loan will be helpful to meet this need so that his family can be comfortable and happy in their own home.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Percy

texts.en: Percy lives in the town of Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helps to generate income through her retail store for a living. She has been doing this for more than three years and recently she joined Gata Daku MPC and gained access to microfinance services. In order to buy canned goods, milk and coffee in sachets and soap, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC. She hope to help uplift their family to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk and coffee in sachets and soap

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen lives in Poblacion Sibutad, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She is married and has two children. She owns and manages a general store selling assorted groceries to make a living. She has been in this business for eight years and is able to support the family needs. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more canned goods, dairy products, and spices. She plans to expand her business and send her children to school so that they can  finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, dairy products, and spices to sell in her general store business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business. She has been in this business for five years. Maria earns more income from her buy-and-sell business for dried coconut meat. Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Thang

texts.en: Thang is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales thus helping her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products to restock her store.

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en: Sumbersari Permai Group got a new loan; there are nine members and the total loan amount is 13.5M IDR. One member couldn’t attend the meeting because she escorted her daughter to hospital. Having been successful with maintaining and fattening pigs, Ni Kadek plans to use the loan to purchase two types of local pigs to make pork rolls; the pigs are maintained for two months. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy feed. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about this business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair her home and also save for the capital of the business.

loans.use: to purchase two types of local pigs and feed.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is 33 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Cherry is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Cherry has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying more gas tanks from different suppliers to satisfy her customers. Lien's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy gas tanks for selling.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 50 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Dominga works very hard to provide for them.

Dominga runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like snack foods, bread, sugar, coffee and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Dominga has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, bread, sugar, coffee and other groceries. 

Dominga would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like snack foods, bread, sugar, coffee and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 43 years old and is single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

She has been run a cafe for 15 years. She intends to use her loan to expand her business by buying new furniture and better quality coffee to sell.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying new furniture and better quality coffee to sell.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy materials for her business providing hairdressing and nail services. Hoa's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for her hairdressing and nail services.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 53-year-old married man. He lives with his children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For ten years, he has run a business processing and selling iron products. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater quantity of iron items to increase his sales.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of iron items to increase his sales.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 48, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a laborer for hire. Dung started a food stall selling breakfast meals to her customers two years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying new furniture for her food stall to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for her food stall to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Afin de renforcer son activité de chaussures, madame Adjowa sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle le fait de façon ambulante et a démarré en 2003. Comme perspectives d'avenir, madame Adjowa espère agrandir son commerce et assurer un avenir meilleur à son seul enfant. Âgée de 42ans,elle est veuve avec un enfant de 23ans en charge.
texts.en:
To strengthen her shoes business, Mrs. Adjowa is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy merchandise. She works as a traveling saleswoman, and started this business in 2003.

She's 42 years old and a widow, and has one 23-year-old child to support. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and ensure a better future to her only child.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Pacifique Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyamusisi est conseillère du collectif d’affaire  «Pacifique»,  jeune femme entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers. La cliente est sociétaire d’une boutique. Elle s’entraide dans cette entreprise avec son mari. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 12 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les nouvelles marchandises (4 sacs de farine froment,  2 bidons d’huile, 2 sacs de sucres, 10 cartons de savons, 5 box des sels, etc.).  Les taxes et tracasseries administratives sont des obstacles pour son entreprise. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Nyamusisi, age 30, is the counselor of Pacifique Group. She's a young and experienced entrepreneur. She's married and the mother of seven children, who all study. Her spouse is a merchant who sells various products.

She is part owner of a store. In this business, she and her husband help each other. She started her business approximately 12 years ago, on her own funds, that she received from her husband.

This new loan will be used to buy new products (4 sacks of common wheat, 2 cans of oil, 2 sacks of sugar, 10 boxes of soap, 5 boxes of salt, etc). Taxes and administrative hassle are obstacles for her business. 

She would like to expand her business, send her children to school and feed them, and build a house. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its support through microcredit for small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of common wheat, 2 cans of oil, 2 sacks of sugar, 10 boxes of soap, 5 boxes of salt, etc

loans.name: José Napoleón

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 35 años de edad, acompañado y con dos hijos. Comenzó a trabajar la tierra con su papá desde muy pequeño, hoy que tiene su propia familia se dedica siempre a cultivar maíz; pero  busca diversificar las formas de obtener ingresos por otros medios: tiene crianza  de conejos, un par de gansos, crianza de cerdos y una vaca;  piensa que entre mas variado tiene su producción puede garantizar  el sustento de su familia y educación de sus dos hijos.

También tiene un pequeño huerto de hortalizas, donde le ayuda a darle mantenimiento su compañera de vida; quien se dedica a oficios domésticos del hogar.

Don José, se considera una persona emprendedora que busca día con día sacar adelante su familia. Compra  algunos insumos en un municipio que esta a 5 kilómetros de distancia de su casa, para bajar costos de producción, recoge los residuos  de la cosecha, propios y de los vecinos (rastrojos, residuos vegetales y comida) para alimentar sus animales y elaborar abono para sus cultivos.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es  para la compra de 2 terneros para criarlos y poder tener un par de bueyes al terminarlos de desarrollar, ya que su sueño siempre ha sido poseer bueyes. Solo cuenta con la carreta que el mismo ha construido. Al tener sus bueyes y carreta podrá trasladar su producción y labrar la tierra. Podrá contar con recursos para trabajar, teniendo ya los bueyes se le podrá facilitar el traslado de sus productos para su comercialización y trabajar la tierra de una forma menos pesada.

Sueña con poder ir a dejar sus productos con su carreta con sus bueyes al mercado del pueblo y poder traer productos para el consumo de su familia de regreso.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old and has two children. As a child he began working the land with his father, and now he has his own family. He has always cultivated corn, but also seeks to diversify and earn income through other means - he has rabbits, a pair of geese, breeding pigs and a cow. 

He believes that having a variety of products will help to ensure food for his family and education for his two children. He also has a small vegetable garden which his life partner helps him to maintain, alongside her household chores. 

José considers himself to be an entrepreneurial man who fights each day to raise his family well. He purchases supplies from a town 5 miles away from his home. To lower production costs, he collects farming residues (such as debris, crop residues and food) from his own land and his neighbors' to feed his animals and make fertilizer for his crops.

The loan that José is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to purchase two ox calves to raise, as his dream has always been to own a pair of oxen. At the moment he only has the wagon, which he built himself. With the oxen and his wagon, José will be able to transport his produce and work the soil. He will have better resources to rely on, as the oxen will facilitate the transportation of his products to the market for sale, and working the land will be less laborious for him.

José dreams of being able to bring his produce to the market with his oxen and wagon, and buy products for his family to bring back home with him.

loans.use: to purchase 2 ox calves to raise, in order to have a pair of oxen to work with once they have grown.

loans.name: Largaespada De Chiquilistagua Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias empresarias una de ellas es Emilsa mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Mary Kay, Reblon, ropa variada y nueva para adultos desde hace 5 años consecutivas. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de perfumen Guess, Chanel, ropa pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, camisas variadas, camisolas, chores etc. Blanca tiene 20 años de edad su negocio es la venta de productos escolares, fritanga, gaseosas zapatos, Estelvina tiene 36 años y su negocio es la venta de comida y tortilla.
texts.en:
This group consists of three businesswomen. One of them is Emilsa who is 21 years old and single. For the last 5 years she has been in business selling perfumes such as Mary Kay and Revlon as well as assorted new clothing for adults. She will use this loan to buy Guess and Chanel perfumes as well as men's and women's trousers, assorted shirts, camisoles, shorts etc.

Blanca is 20 years old and her business sells school products, shoes, fried food and fizzy drinks. 

Estelvina is 36 years old and she is in business selling food and tortillas.

loans.use: to buy Guess and Chanel perfumes and clothing such as men's and women's trousers, assorted shirts, camisoles, shorts etc.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est une femme de 47ans qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle revend des condiments(piments, oignons, tomate)au marché depuis 2007 et s'approvisionne à Lomé et dans les villes de l'intérieur. Pour renforcer son stock, madame Adjowa fait sa première demande de prêt à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. A l'avenir, elle voudrait avoir d'autres points de vente et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Adjowa is a 47-year old woman who is married and a mother. She has been selling condiments (chilis, onions, tomatoes) at the market since 2007 and gets her supplies in Lomé and in towns inland. In order to boost her stock, Adjowa is requesting a first loan from WAGES so that she can buy more goods. In the future she would like to have other sales points and also ensure that her family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy chilis and various other products.

loans.name: Yemalin Femi 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEMALIN FEMI 4 est composé de vingt personnes qui résident le même quartier et qui exercent des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Pauline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pauline est âgée de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Pauline est mariée à un certain Valentin. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Pauline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Pauline supporte ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges du ménage. Pour y parvenir, Pauline vend divers produits vivriers (maïs, riz, etc.) à son domicile depuis quatre ans. Pauline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Pauline désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par ses produits, mais Pauline ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Pauline sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement YEMALIN FEMI 4.
texts.en: The Yemalin Femi 4 group is made up of 20 people who live in the same district and who have income-generating activities. The representative of this group, whose name is Pauline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Pauline is 56 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a man called Valentin and the couple has three children in their care, some of whom are at school. Pauline lives with her children and husband. She and her husband cover the various household expenses between them. In order to do this, Pauline has been selling various food products (corn, rice, etc.) from home for the past four years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. Pauline would like to be able to satisfy more customer demand but does not have sufficient financial means to expand her business. In order to do this she is thus requesting a fourth loan from Alidé together with the other members of the Yemalin Femi 4 group.

loans.use: to buy food products (corn, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Alogojesuton 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ALOGOJESUTON 5 est composé de vingt quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Ablavi Lucie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ablavi Lucie est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Ablavi Lucie a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Ablavi Lucie mène comme activité depuis six ans, la vente de produits cosmétiques à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. Ablavi Lucie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ablavi Lucie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOGOJESUTON 5, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Alogojesuton 5 group is made up of 24 people who live in the same district. It is the second time that this group has requested financial help from Alidé so that they can expand their businesses. The representative of the group, whose name is Ablavi Lucie, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Ablavi Lucie is 41 years old and lives in Benin. She left school at secondary level. In order to provide for her needs she has for the past six years been selling cosmetics from home and also on a door-to-door basis. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing her turnover and income, Ablavi Lucie is requesting, together with the other members of the Alogojesuton 5 group, a second loan from Alidé. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Alogojesuton 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ALOGOJESUTON 6 est composé de vingt deux personnes qui habitent la même région. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Celine Ghislaine est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une seconde fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Celine Ghislaine est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Celine Ghislaine est mariée à un certain Germain. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Celine Ghislaine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Celine Ghislaine vend depuis six ans environs, des tissus et des savons dans son quartier. Celine Ghislaine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et mieux satisfaire à la demande de leur clientèle, Celine Ghislaine et les autres membres du groupement ALOGOJESUTON 6 sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Alogojesuton 6 group is made up of 22 people who live in the same region. The representative of this group, whose name is Celine Ghislaine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This group is requesting a second loan from Alidé so that they can expand their businesses and thus meet customer demand. Celine Ghislaine is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a man called Germain and the couple has five children in their care, some of whom are at school. Pauline and her husband live with their children. In order to be able to contribute to the family's various needs, Celine Ghislaine has been selling fabrics and soaps in her neighborhood for around six years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to be able to boost their businesses and better satisfy customer demand, Celine Ghislaine and the other members of the Alogojesuton 6 group are requesting a second loan from Alidé. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and soaps.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia runs her general store in Poblacion, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte where she lives with her three children. She has been doing this business for more than ten years to earn a living. She recently became a member of Gata Daku MPC and Rosalia borrowed a loan to buy dried fish and bagoong for sale. She hopes to see her children successful in the near future.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and bagoong for sale.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages for her general store

loans.name: Alogojesuton 7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ALOGOJESUTON 7 est composé de quinze personnes qui sont dans un même groupement de femmes et résident dans la même région. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Assiba Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Assiba Jeanne est âgée de 62 ans et vit au Bénin. Assiba Jeanne a très peu fréquenté l’école. Assiba Jeanne ne vit plus avec son mari, mais est mère de cinq enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés, et deux restent à sa charge. Pour subvenir à ses divers besoins et à ceux des enfants à charge, Assiba Jeanne vend depuis cinq ans, des poules, canards et pintades de façon ambulante. Assiba Jeanne s’approvisionne dans le nord du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Assiba Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement ALOGOJESUTON 7, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Alogojesuton 7 group is made up of 15 women living in the same region. It is the second time that this group has requested financial help from Alidé, so that they can expand their businesses. The representative of the group, whose name is Assiba Jeanne, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Assiba Jeanne is 62 years old and lives in Benin. She attended school very little. She no longer lives with her husband but is mother to five children. Some of the children are at school and two are her dependents. In order to provide for the needs of her two dependents, Assiba Jeanne has for the past five years been selling chickens, ducks and guinea fowl on a door-to-door basis. She gets her supplies in the north of Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, Assaba Jeanne, together with the other members of the Alogojesuton 7 group, is requesting a second loan from Alidé. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy chickens, ducks and guinea fowls.

loans.name: Khiet

texts.en:
Khiet, 67, is widowed and has six children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a food stall to sell noodles with pork for people in her community. 

She started this activity 35 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality foods such as noodles, pork and vegetables to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying better quality foods such as noodles, pork and vegetables.

loans.name: Chung

texts.en: Chung would like to take an additional loan to buy shoes and clothes to sell at her store. Chung's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She says that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and enable her to attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes to sell at her store.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 28 years old, and is married with a son. Her husband is working as a decorator. Yen has been running a bakery selling cream cakes for 1 year. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her child. The family live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Yen is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality ingredients to make cakes, so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

Yen hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make and sell cream cakes.

loans.name: Truc

texts.en:
Truc is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been earning money through running a café for the last 17 years.

Truc would like a loan to purchase a greater range of soft drinks, coffee, and furniture. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, coffee, and furniture for her café

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets for his waste management business.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Originally from the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham, Chhin has been involved in agriculture with the full support from her husband in order to meet the family’s needs. She and her husband own a few plots of farmland where they cultivate rice for food and sales. They also own some fishing materials for fishing activities. She is now 52 years old and a mother of three children, all of whom are settled for marriage.

Chhin is requesting this loan because she needs to buy a fishing boat to sustain her family business. With the loan's help, she hopes to gather a lot fish to sell locally to earn a good income. Chhin mentioned that this loan is very important to her family members because it will enable her to increase her daily profits and ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat to sustain her family business.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu would like to take a further loan to buy more beverages to sell from her stall. Thu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. Thu also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy many kinds of fruits to sell at her stall. Thuy's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of fruits to sell

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients and bread to sell from her stall. Phuong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and bread to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 45 years old and married with two sons. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income through running a general store. 

Ha started her business 16 years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different products, from household items to food and beverages, to sell for her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy households items, food and  beverages for selling from her general store.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 42, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a factory in the local community.

Mai has been running a food stall to sell meals for the people in her community for 15 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying rices and foods, in order to make different meals to better satisfy her customers.

Mai hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy rice and foods to make different meals for selling.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 31 años de edad, es acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Aprendió a trabajar en engorde de ganado en repasto y agricultura desde que era un niño, junto a su papá ya que es lo único que sabían hacer debido a que no tienen un nivel de estudios, y a la falta de empleo en El Salvador ,todos los días por la mañana don pedro lleva sus animales al potrero para que coman y por  la tarde los lleva de nuevo a casa para mantenerlos en su corral y no correr el riesgo que se los roben. Don Pedro tiene una yunta de bueyes con la cual ayuda a otros vecinos a arar la tierra y a aporcar sus cultivos, es así como consigue algunos ingresos para mantener sus cultivos y a su familia.

Para comprar sus novillos tiene que abordar un camión en su comunidad y viajar durante 45 minutos hasta llegar al tiangue, ahí se pasa buena parte del día hasta conseguir los animales que le gustan, luego tiene que subir sus animales al camión y regresar a casa,


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  4 novillos de engorde en repasto y también comprara insumos agrícolas para su cultivo de hortalizas y maíz. Con la inversión, comprara sus novillos y repastarlos durante cierto tiempo para luego venderlos y obtener alguna ganancia para la comida de su familia y cancelar su crédito. Al tener mayor número de animales  tendrá mayores ingresos y en una forma mas continua, lo que vendrá a ayudar a que su familia tenga asegurada su subsistencia.

Él  planea trabajar muy duro, para hacer una casa de ladrillo para sus hijos, ya que actualmente vive en una casita de latas, también ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien y sean profesionales
texts.en:
Pedro is 31 years old. He is married and has three children. He learned to work raising cattle when he was a child with his father, since it was the only thing they knew how to do, as they had no education and there is a lack of employment in El Salvador. Every morning Pedro takes his animals to the pasture so that they can eat and in the afternoon he takes them back home again to keep them in their pen and not risk being stolen. Pedro has a yoke for oxen that he uses to help neighbors to plow the land and earth up their crops. That is how he gets other income to support his crops and his family. 

To buy his steers, he has to get on a truck in his community and travel 45 minutes till he arrives in Tiangue. There he spends the better part of a day until he gets the animals he likes and later he has to put them on the truck and return home. 

The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy 4 steers to fatten up with grazing and also buy agricultural materials for his vegetable and corn crops.  With the investment, he will buy his steers and have them graze for a certain amount of time to later sell them and make a profit so his family can eat and he can pay off the loan. When he has a larger number of animals, he will have more income in a more continuous way which will help his family to secure their subsistence.  

He plans to work very hard to build a brick house for his children, since right now they live in a sheet metal house. He also wants to help his children study and have good careers.

loans.use: to buy four steers to fatten with grazing and also to buy agricultural materials to grow vegetables and corn.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 41, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a food stall in front of their house. 

Mai started this business four years ago. She sells meals, pork and noodles for people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality food and ingredients to make different meals and better satisfy her customers.

Mai hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and ingredients to make meals and noodles for selling.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 40 years old, is married and has two children. Her husband supports the family through working as a taxi driver. Dung earns income from running a general store. She has run this business for five years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Dung intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy new products of instant food and beverages to stock her store. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy new products of instant food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

Margarita has been in this business for 6 years. She earns more income from a buy and sell charcoal business.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to have her own boat in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh, 39, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income through selling pork. Hanh runs a general store in front of their house. 

Hanh started this business five years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yoghurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

Hanh hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Gilna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gilna works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Gilna is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Gilna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam is 38 years old and single. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Tam has run a tailor shop at her house for 14 years. She intends to use her loan to buy sewing materials to supply and meet customers' demands. Tam hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 49 years old and is married with four children - three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Thuy has been running a business of selling rice for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thuy is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of rice to stock her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. Thuy hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of rice to stock her store.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi, 46 years old, is married and has two children. Her husband earns money through making clothes. She supports her family through the income she earns from her beauty salon. She started this business twenty years ago. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Chi intends to take a loan to buy hair care equipment and products. The additional material will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business will run smoothly and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy hair care equipment and products to sell.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is a 57-year-old married man. He lives with two children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife does housework. For 20 years, Tam has run a business of buying and selling recycled materials.
