Tam would like a loan to increase his capital for his business, which will help him to purchase a greater quantity of waste materials to recycle and sell to large-scale recycling facilities. He hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: To buy and sell recycled materials.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 46 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, noodles, sugar, milk, laundry soap, cooking oil, etc. in her general store.

Guillerma has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and banana vending.

Guillerma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, noodles, sugar, milk, laundry soap, cooking oil in her general store

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is 46 years old and married with three children. He lives with his family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earns income by running a food stall and selling eggs. 

He started his business 17 years ago. He intends to take a loan to buy larger quantities of eggs from producers to sell to his customers. 

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy eggs to sell.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Mr. Arif  is a 29-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He belongs to a poor family. He is a father of three sons and two daughters. Two of his sons are working in a factory as labourers.

Arif makes clothes by purchasing rough and waste cotton. He purchases rough and scrap cotton, categorizes them and manufactures new cotton cloth. His work is very complicated and needs a lot of time and hard work. He loves his work. 

He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cotton to manufacture cloth. He promises to pay back the loan on time. He wants to buy his own godown (warehouse) in the future to store sacks of multi-colour cotton.

He is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva lenders for great and kind support.

loans.use: to purchase scrap cotton to manufacture cloth.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick  is 65 years old, married and a father of four children. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. Patrick was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for his third loan of KES 30,000, to buy seeds, some fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for his business. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as expand his farming activities. His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing his income so as to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase additional farm inputs for farming activities.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling eggs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie works hard to support her family. Nelie is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Nelie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

Nelie has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Nelie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Mr. Amjad is a 42-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. He is an active borrower from BRAC Pakistan. He belongs to a poor family. He is a father of three sons and three daughters. 

Mr. Amjad sells rickshaw spare parts. He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase rickshaw spare parts to sell. He promises to pay back the loan on time. He wants to save for his children's education. He is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva lenders for the great and kind support.

loans.use: to purchase rickshaw spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Please meet 38-year-old Hawa, from Paynesville North, in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to 'round time marketers,' traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

Hawa is unmarried and has two children, ages five and three, only 1 is in school and they all live at home. Hawa was unfortunate in not attending school, but she is good at managing her business. She describes herself as a hard-working person. 

Hawa has a table in the local market at which she sells palm oil, salt, onion, vita, pepper, etc. She has been in this business for the past four years and works ten hours each day.  

With this loan, Hawa will buy palm oil, salt, onion, vita, pepper, etc. to sell.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income. She transports her goods by shared taxi. She started her business with a loan from her mother.  

Hawa is proud of her business because it provides for her daily expenses. Her plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to buy palm oil, salt, onion, vita, pepper, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Lilia has been in this business for 13 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fruits.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша молодая и позитивная девушка в возрасте 27 лет. Она замужем и имеет двух детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском городке. С детства Бунафша мечтала стать учительницей и после окончание школы она поступила в Педагогическое училище и продолжила обучение. В данный момент она работает учительницей русского языка в местной школе. Муж Бунафши работает юристом. Он тоже учился в университете на эту профессию и успешно закончил обучение, получив диплом о высшем образовании. Бунафша вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Бунафша с мужем хотят купить машину. Они мечтали об этом уже давно, имея машину облегчится их передвижение. Для того, чтобы купить машину, Бунафше необходима большая сумма денежных средств. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку машины. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, в следствие которой улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Bunafsha is a young and optimistic 27 year old woman. She is married and has two children. She lives in a small, rural town. From childhood, Bunafsha dreamed of becoming a teacher and after graduating from high school, she attended teacher's college and continued her education. She currently works as a Russian language teacher at a local school. Bunafsha's husband works as a lawyer. He also studied his profession at university and successfully completed his education, receiving a college degree. 

Bunafsha and her husband strive to do all that they can to provide their children with everything they need. Their combined earnings are enough for an average household. However, until now, they have insufficient funds to cover all of their existing needs. Currently, Bunafsha and her husband want to buy a car. They have dreamt of it for some time now, as having a car would make getting around much easier for them. In order to buy a car, Bunasha needs a large sum of money. For this reason, she approached Arvand to take out a loan to buy a car. She thanks Arvand in advance for their support, which will improve the quality of her family's life.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Sambi Ternak Group

texts.en:
The Sambi Ternak group is borrowing a new loan to purchase a superior quality piglets and feed and to repair cages. This pig business has been shown to supplement the family income.

Because Ketut, one member of the group, already has a sow, she will use this loan to buy two superior piglets for fattening and high-quality feed to help her pigs grow fast. She plans to save money to develop her business, for the family's daily needs are met by her husband. Her husband is very supportive of the efforts made by Ketut. She hopes that her plan runs smoothly so that she can become a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets for fattening and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 30-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He belongs to a poor family.

Khalid owns a small clinic. He wants to purchase medicines and equipment and hire a professional doctor for the clinic. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He promise to pay back the loan on time. He hopes that the loan will be helpful for his business. He is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva lenders for their great and kind support.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and equipment and hire a doctor for the clinic.

loans.name: Barchin

texts.ru:
Барчин является замужней женщиной. Она мать 6 прекрасных детей. У нее большая и дружная семья. Ее муж усердно трудиться и старается поддерживать хорошие условия в своей семье. Барчин с мужем и детьми разводят дома скот. Этим видом деятельности семья занимается уже несколько лет и имеет от этого хороший доход. Также кроме откорма скота они дополнительно выращивают различные овощи и фрукты, так как семья большая и прокормить всех очень трудно. Но Барчин не расстраивается и делает все чтобы его 6 детей ни в чем не нуждались.
 Они с мужем  мечтают построить большую ферму, так как ее муж раньше работал на ферме и имеет опыт в этом деле. Но чтобы строить ферму нужны большие средства, поэтому Барчин пока копит деньги. Она хочет увеличить скот  и до следующего лето накопить достаточную сумму для стройки фермы.
 Настоящий кредит получают для покупки скота. Барчин очень надеется на финансовую поддержку со стороны Арванд и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Barchin is a married woman. She is a mother to six wonderful children. She has a large and close-knit family. Her husband works very hard  and strives to support a good quality of life for his family. Barchin, along with her husband and children, raise cattle at their home. Their family has been doing this kind of business for several years now and has received good earnings from it. In addition to fattening up cattle, they also grow various fruits and vegetables, as its very difficult to feed such a large family. But Barchin has a good attitude and does all that she can so that her six children want for nothing. 

Her children and her husband dream of building a large farm, as her husband previously worked on a farm and has work experience in that field. However, in order to construct a farm, a lot of resources are required, which is why Barchin is currently saving money. She wants to increase her herd of cattle and put away money until next summer for the farm construction. They will receive a loan to buy cattle. Barchin is really depending on the financial assistance from Arvand and thanks them in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio César es un hombre responsable y trabajador, quien desde muy joven ha tenido la determinación de salir delante y contar con una vida estable. Él vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica de lleno a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuidado de su pequeña hija. Con el deseo de poder contar con un hogar seguro que pueda resguardar a su familia de las duras inclemencias del clima, Julio solicita un préstamo, de modo que pueda cambiar el techo de lámina de su casa por uno nuevo y así mismo techar una pequeña área de su casa, con lo que su esposa podrá realizar distintas actividades como lavar trastes tranquilamente a pesar de la lluvia o el sol. Es por esto que Julio solicita el préstamo de manera que pueda comprar láminas, clavos, madera y otros materiales de construcción necesarios.
texts.en:
Julio César is a responsible, hardworking man who has been determined to move forward and have a stable life from a young age. He lives with his wife, who is fully committed to the household duties and taking care of their young daughter. 

Julio has applied for a loan to replace the metal sheets on his house with new ones because he wishes have a safe home to protect his family from the harsh inclement weather. He will also put up a roof over a small area of his house so that his wife can carry out activities such as washing clothes without worrying about the rain or sun. This is why Julio has applied for a loan to buy metal sheets, nails, wood, and other necessary construction materials.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets to improve the roof of his home.

loans.name: Roxana Abigail

texts.es: Roxana Abigail, una joven emprendedora y comprometida al bienestar de su hogar y su familia, ella es soltera y vive junto a sus padre, a quienes les brinda toda la ayuda necesaria ya que son de avanzada edad, razón por la que Roxana trabaja muy duro comercializando carne de res. Debido a que reside en una casa muy humilde y que por falta de recursos no ha podido realizar el mantenimiento oportuno a techos, paredes y puertas, solicita un préstamo para contar con el dinero necesario para hacer cambios de techo en los dormitorios y de este modo resguardarse de las fuertes lluvias que azotan en esta temporada del año. Así también podrá reparar puertas y ventanas, obteniendo mayor seguridad en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Roxana Abigail is an enterprising young woman who is committed to the well-being of her household and her family. She is single and lives with her parents. She gives them all the help they need because they are elderly, so she works very hard selling beef. 

Roxana Abigail lives in a very humble house, and due to her lack of resources, she has not been able to maintain the roof, the walls or the doors. Therefore, she has applied for a loan so that she will have the necessary money to make changes to the roof over the bedrooms, thus protecting the family from the strong rains that fall during this season. She will also be able to repair doors and windows, assuring better security in her home.

loans.use: to buy materials to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.ru: Азамат 20-летний холостой молодой человек. Он проживает с родителями, сестрами и братьями в Яванском районе. Их в семье 10 человек. Азамат является самостоятельным молодым человеком. Несмотря на то, что он ходит на костылях, он собственным трудом зарабатывает на жизнь. В возрасте 17 лет Азамат научился ремонтировать телефоны и открыл свой маленький бизнес. Он предоставляет услуги по ремонту телефона, а также продает там сим карты мобильных компаний. Он занимается собственным делом уже три года. Азамат сейчас нуждается в кредите для продвижения деятельности. На сумму кредита он собирается купить сим карты мобильных компаний и запасные части телефона.
texts.en: Azamat is a 20 year old unmarried young man. He lives with his parents, brothers and sisters in the Yavan region of Tajikistan. There are ten people in his family. Azamat is a self-sufficient young man. Although he walks with crutches, he earns a living through his own hard work. At the age of 17, Azamat learned to repair telephones and opened his own small business. He offers phone repair services and sells sim cards from cell phone companies. He has been doing this for three years already. Now Azamat needs a loan to further his business. With the loan amount, he plans to buy  sim cards from cell phone companies and spare parts for telephone repairs.

loans.use: to buy sim cards from cell phone companies and spare parts for telephone repairs.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is married with four children. He is 49 years old, residing at Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Danilo operates a crop-raising venture, planting and harvesting mangoes for sale to earn a living. Aside from this, he also raises pigs for sale to earn a living. 

He requested a loan of 18,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to purchase feeds and supplies for the pigs.

In the future, Danilo wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and supplies for the pigs.

loans.name: Warmicuna Llanqanchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WARMICUNA LLANQANCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Luciana, ella es casada tiene 46 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos y  cuyes,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia vende los pollos en una de las ferias  de la zona,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos y cuyes para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de animales menores, tienda de abarrotes, crianza de pollos ,crianza de cuyes, venta de hortalizas, venta de comida  y otros socios que son profesores.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the "WARMICUNA LLANQANCHIS" communal bank in the district of Anta, which belongs to Anta province and Cusco department.

The featured member is Luciana, who is a 46-year-old married woman with 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business breeding small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs.  She has been running her business for quite a while and it is doing well as a result of the hard work which she puts in every day.  Luciana sells the chickens at one of the local fairs.  She is a responsible person with a great desire to continue working on behalf of her family.

She is seeking a loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs for her business.

Other members of the group sell small animals, run a grocery shop, breed chickens, breed guinea pigs, sell vegetables and sell food, while other members are teachers.  

Adriana is grateful to those who are helping her achieve her dream in this way and is committed to making her repayments within the set term.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs for their business

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is married with two children. He lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a service-based business providing motor transportation in the community. He has been in this business for two years while his wife is selling food to earn a living. 

He took a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to buy new set of tires. He plans to acquire another motorcycle so he can expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new set of tires.

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 31 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en su negocio de pupuseria, ella aprendió sola  este negocio debido a la falta de empleo en el país y ademas que no tiene ningún nivel de estudio profesional, es así como inicio vendiendo pupusas.

Actualmente, hace licuados de fruta, charamuscas y chocobananos para los niños, cose el maíz por la mañana y a las 2 : 00 p.m. lo lleva a moler en el molino y luego regresa a casa para preparar la masa, el chicharrón y el queso, para iniciar la elaboración de sus pupusas la cual llega hasta las 8 de la noche, los clientes se pueden sentar a comer en el negocio y tambien compran para llevar.

Para comprar su producto tiene que viajar a la ciudad, para esto aborda un autobús en el cual viaja durante 25 minutos al llegar compra en una tienda de mayoreo, luego regresa a casa para hacer algunas labores domesticas y preparativos del negocio 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos y equipo para elaborar tortas mexicanas, ya que ademas de las pupusas hay clientes que buscan otro tipo de comida. también invertirá en la compra de 5 sacos de maíz, gas, bebidas y otros insumos necesarios para desarrollar su negocio.

Al tener una clientela satisfecha, estará segura que sus ingresos serán siempre buenos y estables con esto podrá asegurarse de que a su familia no le falte su comida y estudio a sus hijos.

Ella,  planea tener un negocio muy grande para así darle estudio a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Carmen, 31, is in a relationship and has two children. She has five years of experience in her tortilla business. She learned about this business on her own. Due to a lack of employment in the country and the fact that she has no professional studies, she decided to start selling tortillas.

She currently makes fruit-flavored milkshakes, popsicles, and chocolate bananas for children. She cooks corn in the mornings, and at 2:00 p.m. she grinds it in a mill. Later, she returns home to prepare the flour, pork rind, and cheese to start making her tortillas. This takes her until 8:00 p.m. Clients can sit in and eat in her business or they can buy take-away food.

To buy products, she has to travel to the city by bus for 25 minutes. When she arrives, she buys ingredients in a wholesale store. She later returns home to do some household chores and prepare her business.

She has applied for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy ingredients and equipment to make Mexican tortas, because there are clients who search for other types of food besides her tortillas. She will also invest in the purchase of 5 kilos of corn, gas, beverages, and other necessary supplies to develop her business.

When she has a satisfied clientele, she will be sure that her income will always be good and stable. She will then be assured that her family will not lack food and her children will have an education.

She plans to have a very big business to give her children a good education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and equipment to make Mexican tortas, 5 sacks of rice, gas, beverages, and other necessary supplies to develop her business.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 47 years old and single.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Merlie is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlie has been in this business for 11 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children, three sons and four daughters. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly as a result of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. Due to this he is facing serious financial problems as he is unable to meet the household expenses. 

He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing it. Therefore Bushra, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband pay for the maintenance of the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Bushra is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the maintanance of a rickshaw.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de 60 años de edad, está casado y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Jesus se dedica a la crianza de gallos y gallinas en su centro recreacional. Ha acondicionado su vivienda con todo lo necesario para que sus visitantes disfruten de un momento recreacional con juegos deportivos, bebidas y exposición de aves. Tiene corrales en donde exhibe gallos de pelea, gallos de exhibición o gallos para la venta. También alquila su local para recepciones y eventos sociales.  Se inició en este negocio hace más de 15 años con un pequeño capital, pero viendo la buena acogida que tuvo su negocio fue complementándolo con otras distracciones y actualmente es uno de los locales más visitados de su pueblo. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias económicas que obtiene en cada jornada laboral. Decidió iniciar este negocio para tener una ocupación a la cual dedicar su tiempo ya que en ese entonces atravesaba una complicada situación económica, hoy se siente un próspero empresario e independiente. Ahora viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planeado ampliar su local para aumentar la capacidad de personas y así brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará madera para construir jaulas para los gallos y gallinas.
texts.en:
Jesús, 60, is married and has four children who live with him in his own home. Jesús makes a living raising chickens and hens in his recreational center. He has outfitted his home with everything visitors need to enjoy their recreational time, with sports games, drinks, and bird exhibitions. He has corrals where he exhibits fighting cocks, display cocks, or chickens for sale. He also rents out the property for receptions and social events. 

He started this business more than 15 years ago with a small amount of capital. Due to the good reception the business received, he added more attractions. Currently, it is one of the most visited places in his town. He considers his business to be fairly profitable due to the good income he earns every working day. He decided to start this business in order to have an occupation he could dedicate his time to, because at the time he had a complicated financial situation. Now, he feels like a prosperous and independent entrepreneur. 

Seeing the good results he has had, he now plans to expand his property to accomodate more people and to give his clients greater comfort. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles. He is grateful for the financial support he is receiving in order to move forward, and he is committed to paying his installments on time. With the requested amount, he will buy wood to make cages for chickens and hens.

loans.use: to buy wood to build bird cages.

loans.name: Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cinco socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Fanny mujer de 35 años de edad, acompañada, tiene tres hijos de 15, 14 y 6 años respectivamente, su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva para adulto, tiene 6 años de tener su negocio y otro negocio colateral como es la venta de fritanga desde hace un año. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, camisolas, chores, faldas etc. Rosa tiene 57 años de edad y su negocio es de una pulpería, Ana tiene 55 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa, nacatamales, Flora tiene 25 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de prendas de plata y Anielka tiene 22 años y su negocio es la venta de zapatos.
texts.en:
The group is made up of 5 enterprising members.  One of them is Fanny, who is 35, married and the mother of three children of 15, 14 and 6.  She has been running her business selling new clothing for adults for 6 years and, for the past year, has also run a second business selling fritangas (a meat and vegetable dish).  

She will use the loan to buy clothing such as men's and women's trousers, men's shirts, tops, shorts, skirts etc.

57-year-old Rosa runs a grocery shop, Ana (55) sells clothing and nacatamales (a corn, meat and rice dish), Flora (25) sells silver jewellery and Alielka (22) sells shoes.

loans.use: buy men's and women's trousers, men's shirts, tops, shorts, skirts etc.

loans.name: Sandra Marinela

texts.es: Sandra Marinela, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en una pequeña casa, en la cual también posee su propio negocio. Ella trabaja elaborando y comercializando pupusas, las cuales son un platillo muy típico de este país por lo que poseen muy buena demanda a pesar también de la competencia que existe. Por la falta de recursos Sandra no había podido finalizar el muro que resguarda su casa, por lo que se encontraba a la intemperie, haciéndola un poco inseguro para sus hijos. Es por esta razón que Sandra solicita un préstamo  con el cual pueda comprar: cemento, malla metálica, arena, mano de obra y otros más para la construcción del muro. Gracias a esto su familia estará más segura y sus hijos podrán jugar libremente sin ninguna complicación dentro de una casa que los proteja del exterior.
texts.en:
Sandra Marinela lives with her husband and children in a small house, where she also has her own business. She makes and sells tortillas. They are a very typical dish in this country, which is why there is a very good demand for them despite the competition. 

Due to a lack of resources, Sandra has not been able to finish the wall which protects her house, which is why the house has been open to the outside and somewhat unsafe for her children. Therefore, she has applied for a loan to buy cement, metal netting, and sand, as well as to pay workers for constructing the wall. Thanks to this, her family will be safer and her children will be able to play freely without any problems in a house that protects them from the outside.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 39 años de edad, está casada con José y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada. El trabajo de Elizabeth consiste en la venta de gaseosas al público en general de diversas marcas y sabores, además vende prendas de vestir para niños y adolescentes. Ha establecido recientemente su pequeño negocio en el lugar en donde vive ahora, pero se dedica a esta actividad cerca de 9 años, ocasionalmente ofrece sus productos de casa en casa o visitando a sus familiares y amigo. Siempre ha trabajado sola porque así se siente más tranquila ya que considera que de esa forma mantiene el orden y no tiene ninguna presión al momento de atender a sus clientes. Se siente muy feliz porque sabe que todas las actividades laborales que realiza le producen los ingresos económicos que necesita para solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar, sin embargo sabe que tiene que continuar esforzándose muchísimo para mejorar esta situación, espera seguir trabajando para hacer crecer aún más su negocio y más adelante comprarse un terreno para construir su vivienda. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 4000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de gaseosas de diferentes marcas y sabores.
texts.en: Elizabeth, age 39, is married to José and has two children, with whom she lives in a rented house. Elizabeth's work is selling soft drinks to the general public, in various brands and flavors. She also sells clothing for children and adolescents. She recently established her small business in the place where she lives now, but she has dedicated herself to this work for about 9 years. She occasionally offers her products from house to house, or while visiting her family members and friends. She has always worked alone, because she feels more comfortable this way; she believes that in this way she can stay organized, and she doesn't have any pressure at the time that she is serving her customers. She feels very happy because she knows that all of the work she does produces the income she needs to cover her household's basic expenses. However, she knows that she needs to continue making a great effort to improve this situation. She hopes to keep working so that she can expand her business even more, and in the future to buy a plot of land to build her home. On this occasion, she is requesting 4000 Peruvian soles. She is very moved to know that there are people who are giving her economic support to continue carrying out her work, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments punctually. With the requested amount, she will buy a greater quantity of soft drinks in various brands and flavors.

loans.use: to buy various brands and flavors of soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosedelma

texts.en:
Rosedelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, salt, sugar, yeast, etc. for her bread production business.

Rosedelma has been in this business for 27 years. Rosedelma earns additional income from furniture making and a lumber yard.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her bakery business.

Rosedelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, salt, sugar, yeast, etc. for her bread production business

loans.name: Bearice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 8 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'SEEING HER ANIMALS GIVE BIRTH.'  Her biggest challenge is: 'CHOICE OF BREEDS.'  Animals on the farm have been given the names of  'KILIMO.'

Beatrice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'TRAINING IS DONE BEFORE LOANS ARE DISBURSED.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'IS BEST FOR LOW INCOME EARNERS.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit her family,' Beatrice replied, 'I WILL BUY HIGH BREED ANIMALS WHICH WILL INCREASE PRODUCTION.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Beatrice owns the following: 'cow, poultry', but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in her household 'mosquito net', but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en: Medarda is 55 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates an agricultural business, raising pigs for sale in the local community. She has been in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP every month. Aside from this, she also manages her cocoland, harvesting coco for sale. This is her main source of income. She needs to purchase fertilizer such as manure for the farm, so she requested a loan from Gata Daku MPC, being a member since 2009. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 41 years old and married, with five children, four of whom are in school. Connie works very hard to provide for them.

Connie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, and chips. She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Connie would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, and chips.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María, tiene la edad  de 60 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo, el cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y algunos  materiales que le facilite la reparación en su vivienda y pagar mano de obra en trabajos a realizar a la vivienda, y de esta manera eliminar algunos deterioros que sufre la vivienda y así que quede en buen estado y poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que su familia mejoré su calidad de vida y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rosa María is 60 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, who is her main priority. With her loan she hopes to buy wood and other materials which will enable her to repair her house and to pay for manual labour to carry out the work on the house. In this way she hopes to repair some deterioration that the house has suffered so that it will remain in a good condition and offer a better quality of life to her family. With the money she hopes to make good quality improvements to the house and hopes her family's standard of living will improve. She hopes to be able to benefit from low prices on some of the materials which are of good quality. 

It is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She had not had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to carry out home improvements

loans.name: Sory

texts.en:
Sory, a father of three independent children in his early 60s, is a villager from the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. He is a widower who makes a living via rice farming on a one-hectare area. He has been involved in his current business for ages. 

This is the fourth cycle loan for Sory with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). He has fully paid back his past loan and has used it wisely to improve his living conditions so they are better than before. Now, he is seeking a new loan in order to support his farmland. 

He will use a portion of it to buy medicine for his kid to sell. He hopes this purchase will support his business, as well as his kid's business, on time and that they will make more income.

loans.use: To support his farmland and to buy medicine for his kid's business.

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en:
Ikhlas is a 22-year-old, married woman. She is a mother for one son, who is one year old. Ikhlas is conservative, so her husband is shown in the photo.

Ikhlas’s husband is working as a photographer in the summer. Because this work is classified as a seasonal work, his salary is not enough to cover all the family expenses. So that Ikhlas and her husband have additional work, in the past two years Iklas’s husband has also been raising and selling chicks, which has been a profitable business, but also needs more support to cover business development costs. 

Ikhlas is requesting a USD 3,000 loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing more chicks and expanding and improving the flock's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and expand and improve the flock's condition.

loans.name: Sari Maju Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang will use her portion of the loan to purchase 3 piglets for fattening, at 450,000 IDR each, and will use the rest of her loan to buy pig feeds. She will keep these piglets for 5 months and then sell them to the pig buyer. Because it’s nearly holiday season, the price for pigs is increasing. However, she hopes the price for feed will not follow the increasing price of pigs.

Ni Komang and the other members of the Sari Maju Group feel the benefits of having this loan. They can purchase piglets and feeds, but can also receive training from the breeder. They hope they can gain capital on their own and don’t need to request a loan again.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat is 54 years old and married with eight children: six married children and two dependent children. She earns a living by farming rice on her own farm in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has been in this occupation for more than 20 years. Through her hardships, she can supply enough food for her family and is able to generate a little net profit of about $1.50 per day.

Khat is borrowing 500 US dollars to buy additional fertilizers and to hire people to plow and transplant rice in her rice paddy. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to advance her business and to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and to hire people to plow and transplant rice in her rice paddy.

loans.name: Resalyn

texts.en:
Resalyn, 35, lives in Catadman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one child. Resalyn owns and operates a boarding house. Each month she earns approximately 15,000 PHP from rental fees. She established this service as a way of generating extra income.

Resalyn requested a loan of 18,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to cover the costs of repairing her boarding house. In the future, Resalyn hopes that she will have other boarding houses and a subdivision.

loans.use: to cover the costs of repairing her boarding house.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is 61 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, milk, soap and sugar, etc.

Lorie has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Lorie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, milk, soap and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sai Ram Group

texts.en:
Banita is a married woman, 28 years old, who lives in a remote rural village named Barpadar, in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. The lady sitting in the middle with raised hand is Banita. She lives with her five-member family consisting of her husband and three daughters of 9, 6 and 3 years of age. Her two elder daughters are continuing study in school. She has a very shy nature and always devotes her efforts to getting her family ahead. 

For the last five years, Banita has been running a general grocery shop in her house. Initially she started the business in a low profile with limited items like potatoes, soap, sugar, tea dust, tobacco, chocolates, etc. Gradually she expanded her business and added extra items regularly. 

Due to her good behavior, her business has gradually grown and become established. This year, Banita joined a group of her village named Sai Ram with the existing four members to avail loans from Mahashakti Foundation for expanding her existing business. All members of this group hail from poor backgrounds in the below poverty line category. 

Now Banita is earning 100/200 INR daily from her business. Banita wants to keep more stock for her shop but, due to financial scarcity, she is not able to this. So from this first loan from Mahashakti Foundation, she has planned to buy merchandise for her business such as sugar, vegetables, oil, noodles, potatoes, onions, dough, etc. in bulk. She expects to increase her sales and thereby her income, which will serve to ensure the education and welfare of her children. 

Banita hopes to build a permanent cabin in the center of her village for running her business. She also hopes to provide better education to her children.
 
The other four members of the group are Latika, Premsila, Sundari and Kalpana, who are running a spice business, a shop and washing powder vending business, a vegetable vending business and a vegetable cultivation business, respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing sugar, vegetables, oil, noodles, potatoes, onions, dough, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Arlene has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.
 
Arlene successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Arlene is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 40 years old, married and a mother of nine children. She operates a cafe in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last two years. She earns a monthly profit of 7,150 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of 15,000 KES. Anna intends to use the loan to add foodstuffs such as cooking flour, cooking oil and cereals, and items such as eating plates, tea cups, spoons and so on for her business. 

She will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her children as well as continue expanding her business. In the future, Anna hopes to grow her cafe with a view of owning a well set-up hotel in the area.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs and other items needed for her business.

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a 26-years-old married woman. She is a mother of one son and one daughter. Riham’s son and daughter are still small and they don’t work. Her husband is in the military and he is earning a low salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Riham wants to expand and arrange her house by building another room and doing some decoration. Riham is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help to cover the cost of expanding the house. This will improve the living conditions for Riham’s family.

loans.use: to build another room and do some decoration.

loans.name: Lodgenia

texts.en:
Lodgenia's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn to sell. She is 55 years old, a widow, and has four children. Recently she expanded, and has cultivated an additional lot. She needs financial assistance to cover its costs.  

She is from Malibangcao, Clarin, and has been in farming more than 25 years, earning an amount of about 6,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

Lodgenia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married and has six children. 

To make a living, Wilfreda owns and operates a business venture, providing repair services to local community members. Wilfreda has been operating her business for over 33 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

 In 2010, Wilfreda joined Gata Daku MPC. Recently, she requested a loan  from GDMPC, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and a welding machine. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and a welding machine.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a flower farming business in the Philippines. Ruel has been in this business for 7 years. He earns more income from buying and selling vegetables.

He successfully paid back his previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build his flower business. He is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ruel has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns living by farming vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farming business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Lumo Group

texts.en: Domingas is one of the members from the Lumo Group. She is taking out a loan to add more to her own working capital in order to buy some additional supplies, such as cakes, firewood and other items to sell. She is a hardworking woman. She started her business in 2008 with her own working capital of $30.00.

loans.use: to buy cakes, firewood and other items to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and rice retailing. Aida is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., for her general store business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sugar, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 50, is a widow with two children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elena has been in this business for five years.

Elena requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
Mansur is a 19-year-old single man. He is living in a humble house with his family in Tulkarem. Mansur’s mother is employed with a small salary which is not enough to cover all the needed expenses. 

Mansur is requesting a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN to buy a vegetable cart and buy some seasonal crops to sell from it in the local market. This project is profitable and will offer Mansur better life conditions. This loan will increase Mansur’s income and help him in self-reliance. Mansur appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a vegetable cart and some seasonal crops.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with four children. Erlinda is 47 years of age and lives in Culo Molave, Zamboanga Del Sur.

Erlinda sells dry goods to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, She earns 5,000 Philippines pesos doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

Erlinda has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost five years. In the future, Erlinda hope to expand her business and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Carmena

texts.en:
Carmena is married and has five children. She is 41 years old and resides in Calabayan, Ozamis City. She owns and operates a motorcycle-transport business to earn a living. Aside from this, she also sells dried fish in the community to add to her income. 

She requested a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order  to purchase dried fish and bagoong (shrimp paste) for sale. Carmena has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, Carmena wants to build a house and have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and bagoong (shrimp paste) for sale.

loans.name: Yemalin Femi 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEMALIN FEMI 6 est composé de dix sept personnes. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Thérèse est celle s'est habillé en tissus de couleur violette et qui se trouve devant (sur la première ligne) et en deuxième position, juste à côté de celle ayant porté une robe jaune. Thérèse est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Thérèse n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Thérèse est une veuve et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Thérèse vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Thérèse exerce depuis cinq ans, la vente d'huile de palme et de produits vivriers à son domicile. Thérèse s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Thérèse sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement YEMALIN FEMI 6, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The YEMALIN FEMI 6 group comprises seventeen members. It is the third time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise its level of activity.

Thérèse, the group's representative, is the woman wearing a purple outfit, second from the left in the front row, next to another woman dressed in yellow. She is 47 years old and lives in Benin.  She never attended school.  She is a widow and the mother of two children who both go to school and are her dependents.  She lives with her children.  

In order to cover the household's various expenses, Thérèse has been selling palm oil and food products, from her home, for the past five years.  She buys her merchandise from a market located in Benin.

In order to satisfy the needs of her customers, and to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the YEMALIN FEMI 6 group.

loans.use: to buy food products and palm oil.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, like soap, canned goods, milk, etc. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like soap, canned goods, milk, etc.

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou is 27 years of age and lives in Poblacion, Sominot, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is single and available.

Malou sells assorted dry goods, and she also buys gold to earn a living. She has had this type of business for three years. She requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

Malou has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost two months. In the future, Malou hopes to expand her business and also her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Wambui

texts.en: Wambui is 51 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For the last 34 years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 18,900. Wambui was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and she is applying for her third loan, of KES 50,000, to buy additional stock for her business, such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on, to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children, and to expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing stock for her business.

loans.name: Hedayah

texts.en: Hedayah is a 22-year-old single woman. She is living in a humble house with her brothers. Hedayah's two brothers work as employees in a local company and receive low incomes. She is applying for a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to finish building the family’s new home, by buying windows and doors. This loan will afford Hedayah and her family better living conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their new house. Hedayah is conservative, so her brother is shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy windows and doors to complete building the family's house.

loans.name: Yemalin Femi 7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEMALIN FEMI 7 est composé de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Constantine est celle qui se trouve devant (dans la première rangée) et ayant porté un haut noir. Constantine est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Constantine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Constantine est mariée à un certain Léon. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Constantine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Constantine prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz, etc.) qu'elle vend dans une ville du Bénin. Constantine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Constantine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement YEMALIN FEMI 7, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group YEMALIN FEMI 7 is composed of 15 persons who live in the same neighborhood. It's the second time that this group is requesting financial aid from  ALIDé, to raise the level of their businesses. The representative of the group, Constantine, is the one who is in front (in the first row) wearing a black top. 

 Constantine is 44 and lives in Bénin. She did not attend school. She is married to Leon. The couple have four children, all still living under their roof. Constantine lives together with her husband and children. 

In order to support the family, Constantine makes cooked food (corn porridge, rice, etc.) that she sells in a town in Benin. She buys her supplies in Benin. 

Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her turnover and her income, Constantine, together with the other members of  YEMALIN FEMI 7, is asking for a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan has been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (rice, maize etc.)

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as a seaman, and she runs a general store for additional income to earn a living. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase canned goods, rice and corn grits, and feeds for sale. She plans to save a portion of her income as a reserve for the future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, rice and corn grits, and feeds for sale.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela lives in Poblacion, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and a single mom. 

She operates a beauty parlor in the community. She has been doing this for 13 years. 

She became a member of Gata Daku MPD recently and she borrowed a loan to buy a new hair curler set, manicure and pedicure sets and hair color. She plans to improve and expand her business to gain more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new hair curler set, manicure and pedicure sets and hair color.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 35 years old and married with two children.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. 

Jennifer requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, milk, soft-drinks, canned goods, etc., to sell in her general store.

Jennifer has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Jennifer aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, milk, soft-drinks, canned goods, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a motorcycle-transport business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a 17,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Imelda applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Imelda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband earns insufficient income to meet the houshold needs.

Her husband owns an embroidery materials shop which is the only source of income for the family. He sell a variety of embroidery materials in his shop. He wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, buttons and pearls of various colors for the shop. However, due to lack of funds he finds it difficult.

Therefore Sakina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business.

loans.use: to buy thread, fancy cloth, buttons and pearls of various colors

loans.name: Juana Asael

texts.es:
Juana tiene 57 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos. Toda su vida se a dedicado a la venta de ropa ambulante, para lo cual tiene que ir de casa en casa por varias comunidades para ofrecer la ropa que vende, es así como ha crecido a sus 2 hijos, también posee 2 maquinas de coser con las cuales confecciona sabanas, sobrefundas y otras prendas que le solicitan. sus padres no le pudieron dar estudio, razón por la cual nunca a podido tener un empleo formal y digno, es por esto que encontró en la venta de ropa ambulante su única fuente de ingresos, para ello tiene que caminar durante todo el día para ofrecer su producto a la mayor cantidad de personas posible, a veces tiene que dejar fiado y luego de un tiempo tiene que pasar a cobrar lo que le deben, aunque esto es un riesgo ya que hay personas que no le pagan.


Para comprar su producto tiene que viajar a la ciudad, para esto aborda un autobús en el cual viaja durante 10 minutos, hasta llegar a la ciudad, ahí realiza sus compras, para luego  regresar a casa a ordenar la venta y luego sale a vender.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar diversas cantidades de ropa para niños, hombres y mujeres, también invertirá en algunas cosas que quiere mejorarle a su casa.

De esta manera ella, dispondrá de ropa muy variada y aumentara sus inventarios con el objetivo de  satisfacer a sus clientes ya que podrá llevarles ropa a su gusto, también conseguirá que le den precios mas bajos y se evitara viajar a cada rato a la ciudad a comprar. Esto contribuirá a ayudar a que el negocio sea mas estable y competente, y que sus ingresos sean permanentes y estables.
texts.en:
Juana is 57 years old and is a mother of two children. She has worked all her life as a street vendor selling clothes, which means she has to go from house to house in various communities to offer the clothing she has for sale. This is how she has brought up her 2 children. She also has 2 sewing machines on which she makes sheets, pillowslips and other garments which people ask her for. Her parents were unable to send her to school and for this reason she has never been able to have a formal or decent job. That is why she found selling clothing as a street vendor was her only way of making an income. She has to walk all day to offer her clothing to as many people as possible. Sometimes she has to leave items on credit and return later to collect what she is owed, although this is risky as sometimes people do not pay her.

To buy her stock she has to travel to the city, which is a 10 minute journey away by bus. In the city she makes her purchases and then returns home to prepare the stock for sale before going out to sell.

The loan she is asking for from Fundación Campo will be used to buy various amounts of clothing for men, women and children and also to invest in some items with which she wants to improve her home.

In this way she will have a very varied range of clothing and will increase her stock with the aim of satisfying her customers, since she will be able to take them the sort of clothing they like. She will also be able to give them lower prices and avoid having to go to the city all the time to buy stock. This will help her business to become more stable and reliable and make her income stable and permanent.

loans.use: to buy various amounts of clothing for men, women and children and also to invest in some items to improve her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for her son's clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en: Simeon is 21 years old. For the past two years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town. He earns a monthly profit of KES 5,500. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan, in the amount of KES 10,000. He is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorbike. He will reinvest the profits in his business. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses, so he can improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to service and repair the motorcycle he uses in his business.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en: Rona is 34 years old and has four children. Rona is married, and three of her children are in school. Rona is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Rona applied for a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Rona has been in the pig-fattening business for five years and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Rona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 36 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She weaves baskets for a living in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last 16 years. She earns a monthly profit of 14,150 KES. She was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan, of 20,000 KES. Lucy intends to use the loan to acquire weaving material for her business. She will save the anticipated profits, which will help her to pay school fees for her children, and to continue expanding her business. In the future, Lucy hopes to grow her business and have a well-established boutique, with the aim of improving her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

Recently, his rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of that, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, as a member of a two-person lending group, Shakeela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shakeela is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en: Nelie is a 65-year-old widow with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Nelie is a farmer, and she owns a plot of land where her coconut and banana trees are planted. This is her main source of income. She has been doing this for more than 20 years. She has applied for a loan of from GDMCP to but fertilizer, such as manure. Nelie hopes to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Mirian Johanna

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó tiempo atrás con el negocio del bazar, lo cual le ayudaba a pagar sus estudios universitarios.  Posteriormente, se graduó y comenzó a prestar servicios contables, pues esa era su especialización profesional.  Trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio.  Es solteria y no tiene hijos.  En un futuro sueña con poder montar una oficina de consultorías tributarias y construír una casa en la playa.  Actualmente necesita el dinero para comprar una computadora y artículos para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in the city of Portoviejo.  Some time ago, she started her general store, which helped her to pay for her university studies.  Later she graduated and started to work as an accountant, which was her area of specialization.  She works alone every day in her business.  She is single and has no children.  In the future, she dreams of being able to set up her own tax consulting office and build a house on the beach.

At this time, she needs money to buy a computer and some products for her store.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some products for her store

loans.name: Enma Asunción

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Inicio su actividad tiempo atrás, cuando sus hijos le regalaron el capital inicial para poder emprender el negocio y pudo comprar la mercadería.  Es casada y su esposo le ayuda a laborar en la tienda todos los días y además de hacer las compras de mercadería para abastecer la tienda.  Trabajan desde muy temprano en la mañana.  Tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad quienes ya están casados y tienen su actividad independiente.  Necesita el préstamo para invertir en víveres y productos varios para el negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Portoviejo.  She started her business some time ago, when her children gave her some start-up capital so that she could launch her own business and buy merchandise.  She is married, and her husband helps out in the store every day and also buys the merchandise to stock the store.  They work starting from very early in the morning.  They have 2 grown children who are already married and have their own independent activities.  

She needs a loan to invest in groceries and various products for her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and a variety of other products

loans.name: Berebido Group

texts.en: Madalena is one the members of Berebido Group She is taking out the loan to add to her working capital and buy some additional goods, including cakes and wheat. She is a hardworking woman. She started her business in 2009 with her own working capital of $50.

loans.use: to buy additional goods, including cakes and wheat.

loans.name: Señor De Ccoyllority De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Concepción ella es casada y tiene 31 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de producción y venta de leche, la socia tiene ganados y producen leche y lo vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia ya tiene en este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijo, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la leche. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche al por mayor.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de llantas, negocio de venta de granos secos y negocio de crianza de animales.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Anta in the province of Anta and department of Cusco. 

One of the members is Concepción who is married, is 31 years old and has 1 son. She works from 6am to 4pm in her milk production and retail business. She has cattle which produce milk which she sells at various fairs. She has had the business for 5 years and it is going well. Through the business she is able to provide for her son. Her dream is to have premises where she can sell the milk. She is asking for the loan to buy milk wholesale.

The member whose photo is attached to the group photo asked permission to have his photo taken after the meeting for work reasons.

The other group members earn a living from businesses selling vegetables, selling tyres, selling bulk dry grains and breeding animals.

Concepción thanks  everyone who helps her to realise her dream by providing the loan and promises to keep up with the payment of her loan instalments in the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy milk wholesale.

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Gerry is 36 years old, married, and a resident of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He  has operated his own motorcycle transport business to earn a living for years, earning 6,000 PHP each month.

Gerry joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services. He is now requesting a loan to buy a new set of tires and to make a down payment on a side car. When he saves enough funds, he will buy a vacant lot for farming in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires and to make a down payment on a side car

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. Gloria earns additional income from food vending.

Gloria is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store, like chips, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs and noodles.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like chips, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs and noodles

loans.name: Camnasa Group

texts.en: Terezinha is one the members of Camnasa Group. She is a hard-working woman, who started her business in 2007 with her own working capital of $50.00. She is taking a loan to add to her own working capital in order to buy additional supplies, such as flour and sugar to make cakes to sell.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar to make cakes to sell

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Deysi, de 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores con quienes vive en su casa propia. Deysi se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, pan, azúcar, huevos, entre otros productos de uso continuo como desodorantes, perfumes, gel, y otros accesorios. Tiene su negocio instalado en su hogar, el cual está ubicado en la calle mas concurrida de su sector. Su mercadería la renueva cada 2 o 3 días dependiendo de la fluidez de las ventas invirtiendo siempre una buena cantidad de dinero en cada producto. Lleva 10 años en este negocio y lo realiza sola ya que su esposo se dedica a otra actividad. Complementa sus ingresos económicos con la venta de prendas de vestir femeninas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar su tiempo para estar con su familia, afirma que las ganancias económicas que recibe semanalmente son muy lucrativas y eso le brinda la tranquilidad necesaria para enfrentar los gastos básicos de su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está contenta de saber que tiene el apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes. Se compromete a ser puntual con el pago sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, aceite, pan, azúcar, huevos, leche, embutidos y otros.
texts.en:
Deysi, 55 years old, is married and has three adult children with whom she lives in her own house.  Deysi makes a living selling food products such as rice, bread, sugar and eggs, among other products of constant use like deodorants, perfumes, gels and other accessories.  She has her business set up in her home which is located on the busiest street in her area.  She restocks her merchandise every 2 or 3 days depending on the flow of sales, always investing a good amount of money in each product.
