The loan will be earmarked to strengthen the business with the purchase of equipment (three television sets and three PlayStations).  Alexis’ dream is to have a well-equipped video games salon that’s well-known throughout the neighborhood; he’d also like to have a business selling lights.

loans.use: to buy three television sets and three PlayStations.

loans.name: Enrique Ruben

texts.es: El Sr. Enrique  tiene 23 años, soltero, el se dedica a la confección de prendas de  vestir tiene su taller de costura en la zona de Chamoco Chico de la Ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es el primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Enrique  va a usar este préstamo  para capital de trabajo (compra de maquina Over y recta) para su negocio, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es hacer crecer el negocio, El Sr. Enrique  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la competencia del mercado y la falta de maquinaria para la confección de prendas de vestir y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando las maquinas que le hacen falta y así de esta manera  incrementar su capital de trabajo, su deseo para su  negocio es tener un taller de costura más grande contratar personal que le ayude a confeccionar sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Enrique, 23, is single and works making clothes; his workshop is in the city of La Paz’s Chamoco Chico zone.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and Enrique will use it as working capital.  He will buy an overlock and a straight-stitch sewing machine for his business.  The reason for requesting this loan is to make the business grow.

The business challenge Enrique faces is competition in the market place and the lack of machinery to make clothes and he will use profits to continue buying the machines he still needs so that he can increase his working capital.  His wish for his business is to have a larger workshop and to hire staff to help him make the clothes.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines.

loans.name: Ngah

texts.fr: Ngah une femme de 55 ans séparée de son mari, mère de 7 enfants dont l'age varie entre 13 et 35 ans.Tous deux vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail (plantains, pistaches, arachides, maïs,couscous en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 14 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera s'approvisionner en plantains, et pistaches  pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ngah is a 55-year-old woman who is separated from her husband. She is a mother of seven children, from 13 to 35 years old. Two of them go to school. For fourteen years, she has been a retailer selling plantains, pistachios, peanuts, corn, and couscous according to the season at a local market. She is very familiar with suppliers and especially her customer base, which she has acquired over the course of time, thanks to her experience in this domain. 

But she constantly finds herself short of stock because she is compelled to sell everything she has in order to procure more again. This is due to her meager capital. She would like to stock up on plantains and pistachios to have a good stock enabling her to do better satisfying the constant demand from her customers and to avoid shortages. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise, such as peanuts, corn, and plantains.

loans.name: Somtinda Group

texts.fr:
Mme  AGUERATOU  représente le  groupe SOMTINDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 09ans et le moins âgés à 03ans. 01 va  à l’école et elle a 04 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend de produits de beauté (mèches, pommades, pagnes etc.) depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les voisins et les amis.
Elle veut s’acheter  01 douzaine de pommades et 01douzaine de mèches.
Elle  veut renforcer son activité avec  ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne agrandir son champs d’activité et  mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Agueratou is the representative of the Somtinda group. She is married and the mother of two children. Her oldest child is 9 years old and her youngest is 3. One of her children is in school.  Agueratou supports four people.

Agueratou has been selling beauty products such hair extensions, ointments and traditional fabrics for seven years. She stocks up at the Grand Market and at the District 10 market, and resells her merchandise to friends and neighbors. 

She wants to buy 12 ointments and 12 hair extensions. 

She plans to use her profits to boost her business. Her goal is to expand her activity and to better provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy 12 ointments and 12 hair extensions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Abahujumugambi Twese / Rbv Group

texts.fr: Saveline est membre du groupe VUGUKORA B / RBV, ELLE A 64 ANS , ELLE A étudiée les études primaires. elle a 4 enfant dont le plus grand a 25 ans et le plus petit a 18 ans. 1 enfant va à l`école. Elle veut le crédit pour acheter les angrais chimiques , payer le main d`oeuvre et acheter les graines de Choux. Elle n`attend aucune difficulté pour le remboursement.ses stratégies pour la croissance de son affaire est de moderniser sa production en utilisant les angrais chimiques. Ses ambitions est de construire sa propre maison d`habitation et éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en: Saveline is a member of the group VUGUKORA B / RBV. She is 64 years old and has a primary school education. She has four children, of whom the oldest is 25 years old, and the youngest is 18. One child goes to school. Saveline wants a loan to purchase chemical fertilizers and cabbage seeds and to pay the cost of labor. She expects no difficulties at all in paying back the loan. Her strategies for business growth include modernizing her production by using chemical fertilizers. Her ambitions include building her own house and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Wend Teldo Group

texts.fr:
Mr  ISSA représente le  groupe WEND TELDO. Marié, Il est père de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgés à 11mois. 02 vont  à l’école et il a 05 personnes  en charge.
Mr vend de pagnes DANFANI depuis 15 ans.  Il s’approvisionne avec les tisseuses de Zongo. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  environ 1250 pagnes tissé.
Il  veut épargner  ses bénéfices afin de s’acheter un tricycle. Mr ambitionne agrandir son champs d’activité et  améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa represents the Wend Teldo group. He is the married father of four children aged 11 months to 12 years old, two of whom go to school. He supports five people. 

Mr. Issa has been selling Danfani pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) for 15 years. He buys his stock from Zongo weavers and sells to both men and women.

He wants to buy approximately 1250 woven pagnes. He wants to save his profits to buy a tricycle. He plans to expand his activity and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy approximately 1250 woven pagnes.

loans.name: Nuruyla

texts.ru: Нуруйла, 53 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей (2сына и 2 дочери). Образование-среднее. С 2008 года занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, также есть свое хозяйство. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец и 5 коз, а также имеется 2,50 ГА поливной земли на которой она ежегодно выращивает ячмень и сено. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Нуруйла обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60 000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Нуруйла планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве. В будущем Нуруйла мечтает построить большой, хороший дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Nuruyla is 53 years old, married and has four children (two sons and two daughters).  She has a secondary education.  She has been involved in farming and animal husbandry since 2008, having started this business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  To-date, she was able to grow her farming business and has a livestock farm.  Her farm contains two dairy cows, ten sheep and five goats.  She also has 2.50 hectares of irrigated land, where she annually grows barley and hay.  In order to further develop her livestock farm and farming business, Nuruyla requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sheep.  Nuruyla plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further increase of livestock quantity on her farm.  She dreams of building a good, large house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Saïgbénan Elisée

texts.fr: Agé de 36 ans, Saïgbénan Elisée est veuf avec un enfant scolarisé. Saïgbénan Elisée assure seul les diverses charges de son enfant. Saïgbénan Elisée a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Saïgbénan Elisée est un dessinateur et un peintre. Pour répondre aux besoins de son enfant et faire face à ses besoins, Saïgbénan Elisée vend des peintures. Saïgbénan Elisée s'approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Saïgbénan Elisée  sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Saïgbénan Elisée, age 36, is the widowed father of one child who goes to school. He is the sole provider for his child. 

Saïgbénan Elisée received a secondary level education. He makes a living sketching and painting. 

To support himself and his child, Saïgbénan Elisée sells paintings.He buys his supplies in Nigéria. 

In an effort to meet customer demand, Saïgbénan Elisée is seeking a 4th loan from ALIDé. All past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Leana Maria

texts.es: Doña leana de 64 años de edad posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes por su buen servicio, además por los precios realmente accesibles; doña leana es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de  salir adelante, tiene una actitud de  ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, doña leana  quiere hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor  para seguir con su negocio que le genera muy buenas ganancias y de esa forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
Leana, 64, has a very well-known tortilla shop in the location where she lives.  She has many customers because of her good service and also because of the truly accessible prices.  

Leana’s a very enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She has a winning attitude which is why she always stays ahead of the competition.  

She lives in her own house with her husband and son.  Leana wants to make her business grow which is why she’s requested a loan from Integral that will make it possible for her to buy corn at wholesale so she can stay in her business that generates good profits so that she can bring economic security home and a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.es:
Marieta tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus padres.
Marieta se dedica a la venta de comidas como en un restaurante ubicado en su propia casa, donde tiene varias mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes. Tiene más de 04 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento su mamá es quien más la ayuda, atendiendo a los clientes.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico constante que le sirve para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Considera rentable a su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, por tanto tiene planes de continuar en el negocio buscando hacerlo crecer.
Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. 
Con el monto de 800 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas  como arroz, azúcar, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Marieta, 24, is single living in a rented house with her parents.  Marieta works selling food in a restaurant located in her house; she has several tables and chairs there for the comfort of her customers.  She’s been in this business for more than 4 years and to date her mother is who most helps her with customer service.

She likes her business because it generates constant income that serves to cover her household expenses.  She considers her business profitable because of the good profits it nets so she has plans to stay in business and to find ways to make it grow.  

This will be her second Kiva loan so she hopes for your collaboration so she can make her plans reality.  She will use the 800 new soles to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, oil and others needed to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar and oil to prepare food.

loans.name: Miriam Elizabeth

texts.es: Miriam de 49 años tiene una pequeña librería en su lugar de residencia tiene varios años de tener su negocio que le genera muy buenas ganancias, tiene mucha clientela pues tiene su negocio bien surtido con variedad de productos escolares, vive en casa propia con su familia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Miriam esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar  cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, folders, papel bond, colores, etc. por mayor  para poder seguir con su negocio darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Miriam, 49, has a small bookstore at home; she’s had the business for several years and it generates very good profits.  She has many customers because her shop is well-stocked with school supplies.  

She lives in her own house with her family and uses profits earned to cover some of the expenses that crop up at home.  Miriam’s requesting a loan to be able to buy notebooks, mechanical pencils, pencils, folders, bond paper, colored pencils, etc. at wholesale to be able to stay in business and provide for her family with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, mechanical pencils, pencils, folders, bond paper, colored pencils, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 45 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica al comercio, venta de tortillas, elotes, locos, tamales, agua y mas,desde hace unos 20 años. Fue la necesidad que la llevo a  aprender el trabajo,pues era la única forma de ayudar a su esposo. Ella cuenta que un día platicando con unas amigas les comento su situación, y fueron ellas las que la invitaron a iniciarse en el negocio de la venta ambulante,en los buses; después que muere su esposo,ella continua vendiendo en los buses, y lo hace con mucha gana, pues ha sido el medio con el cual ha sacado sus hijos adelante.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 10 sacos de maíz, 3 camionadas de leña para tener de reserva,  invertirá en la reparación de la champa, donde elabora las tortilla,también comprar algunas herramientas para el negocio.


Lo que desea hacer en un futuro, es construir un buen lugar para vender,y ya no tener que hacerlo en los buses,pues ya no tiene las mismas fuerzas de antes.
texts.en:
Reyna, 45, is a widow with two children.  She’s a merchant.  She’s been selling tortillas, corn, ‘locos’ [roasted corn on the cob with various seasonings], tamales, water and others for about 20 years.  

Need led her to learn to work because it was the only way to help her husband.  She relates that one day while chatting with her friends she told them about her situation and they invited her to start a business selling from place to place.  When her husband died, she continued selling on buses and she does it very energetically because it’s been the way with which she’s been able to support her children.

The loan she’s asking from Fundación Campo is to buy ten sacks of corn, three truckloads of firewood to have in reserve and she will invest in the repair of the shed where she makes the tortillas and will also buy some work tools.

What she’d like to do in future is to build a good place to sell in so that she won’t have to do so on the buses anymore because she no longer has the strength she used to have.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and to repair the shed and also to buy some business tools.

loans.name: Cacely

texts.es:
Cacely tiene 35 años, está casado y vive en su propia casa junta su esposa y sus hijas. Cacely, se dedica al agricultura de su terreno de 10 hectáreas en las cuales tiene sembrado  palma aceitera la cual está en producción, ya que lleva en ese negocio poca mas de 04 años, y ahora se dedica a la cosecha y venta de su producción. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico adicional con el cual solventar sus gastos, así como el sentirse ocupado. Por otro lado viendo que le resultan más rentables las palmas aceiteras tiene planes de dedicarse más de lleno a esa actividad.
Este será su segundo préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. 
Con el monto de 2000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico y en la cosecha de su producción de palma aceitera.
texts.en:
Cacely, 35, is married and lives in his own house with his wife and his daughters.  Cacely earns a living in agriculture on his 10 hectares of land planted with oil palms, which is in production.  He has little more than four years of experience in this business.  Currently he's harvesting and selling his crop.

He likes his business because it allows him to have an additional income to pay his expenses and to keep busy.  Also, seeing that oil palms are more profitable for him, he's planning to devote himself more fully to that activity. 

This will be his second Kiva loan.  He hopes for your help to continue with his goals.

He'll invest the amount of 2000 nuevos soles [PEN] in buying organic soil amendments and in harvesting his oil palm crop.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments for his oil palm harvest

loans.name: Oké Louis

texts.fr: Oké Louis âgé de 34 ans est marié à une marchande du nom de Julienne. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Oké Louis vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Oké Louis a très peu fréquenté l'école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. C'est pour cette raison que Oké Louis vend des madriers et des bois dans sa région depuis quatre ans. Oké Louis s'approvisionne dans une autre région du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Oké Louis sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Oké Louis, age 34, is married to a reseller named Julienne. They have four children, some of whom go school. Oké Louis himself received minimal schooling. He lives with his wife and their children, and the couple handle the various household expenses together. To that end, Oké Louis has been selling planks and various lumber locally for four years. He buys his stock in another region of Bénin. 

To meet customer demand, Oké Louis is seeking a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy planks and other lumber.

loans.name: Liznarda

texts.es:
Liznarda tiene 59 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junta su esposo y su única hija.
Liznarda se dedica a la venta de comidas diversas. Para eso cuenta con 1 refrigeradora que es su material de apoyo en su trabajo.  Esta actividad  lo realiza en su domicilio, desde este lugar atiende a sus clientes muy amablemente. 
Lleva dedicándose a éste negocio más de 10 años, siendo muy conocida por la zona.  
Considera rentable a su negocio pues ésta acostumbrada a esa actividad y le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten solventar los gastos de su hogar y la apoyar en la educación de sus nietos. Ahora  tiene planes de abrir ampliar su local comercial para una mejor atención al público en general.
Este es su tercero préstamo con Kiva, se siente contenta con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. 
Con el monto de 800 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para preparar sus comidas como papas, arroz, y otros.
texts.en:
Liznarda is 59 years old, married, and lives in her own house with her husband and their only daughter. She earns her living selling various kinds of food. She owns a refrigerator which is a great help to her with this work. Liznarda works from home where she provides her customers with friendly service.

She's been running her business for more than ten years and is well-known in the neighbourhood. Her business is doing well because Liznarda knows what she is doing; she makes a good living from it. With the money she earns she is able to cover household expenses and help pay for her grandchildren's education. Now she wants to expand her business and provide even better service to the public.

This is Liznarda's third loan with Kiva and she is happy to have this opportunity to borrow money to improve her business. With the 800 soles loan money she plans to buy ingredients such as potatoes, rice etc. for the meals she makes.

loans.use: Buy ingredients such as potatoes and rice

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Don Ricardo de 53 años vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas especialmente al de güisquil y ejotes desde hace 10 años, vende sus hortalizas en los mercados que están cerca de su vivienda, tiene mucha clientela porque sus cosechas son frescas y a precios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, don Ricardo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para seguir con sus cosechas y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ricardo, 53, lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  He’s worked growing vegetables, especially chayote and corn, for ten years.  He sells his vegetables in markets near his house.  He has many customers because his crops are fresh and at accessible prices.  He uses profits earned to cover some of his household expenses.  Ricardo is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizer and to pay labor costs to continue with his crops and to earn higher profits to give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However, due to the lack of money, Shamim’s husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Shamim is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and has six children. Josephine is married and has one child in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business raising cattle in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her cattle. Josephine has been raising cattle for 28 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Maria Eliberta

texts.es:
La señora  María  Eliberta  de 55 años  de edad es soltera  vive con sus  dos nietos en su casa de habitación y se dedica desde hace 12  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería.
Doña María Eliberta su negocio está ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras en su negocio ella vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña María Eliberta  vende de todo y gracias a su actividad  ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora mantiene dos nietos.
Doña María Eliberta  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería como frescos, leche, agua, café, pan, azúcar, mantequilla, frijoles, manteca, salsas, etc.  Con el apoyo de este crédito espera poder  mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejore su calidad de vida, desea mejorar su casa y su negocio, es una señora luchadora.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013
texts.en:
María Eliberta is 55 years old and single. She lives in her house with her 2 grandchildren. For the last 12 years she has been selling groceries in her store which is situated in the town of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. In her store she sells all sorts of everyday groceries. She is a hard-working and very enterprising woman with a desire to improve her situation. María Eliberta sells all kinds of things and as a result of her business she has been able to bring up her children and now looks after 2 grandchildren.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy groceries such as soft drinks, milk, water, coffee, bread, sugar, butter, beans, lard, sauces etc. With the help of this loan she hopes to be able to improve her income and thereby improve her quality of life. She wants to improve her house and her business. She is a very determined woman.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk, water, coffee, bread, sugar, butter, beans, lard, sauces etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA 2008”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia hace trabajos de aretes, collares y pulseras y lo vende en forma independiente las diferentes personas, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene en este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien. en sus tiempos libre a la socia le gusta salir con sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de aretes, pulseras y collares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales para hacer los collares, pulseras y aretes como hilos y piedras.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues de la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de artesanía.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These entrepreneurs belong to the communal bank "FUERZA 2008" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Lourdes, 48, who is single and has two childen.  She has a craft business and makes earrings, necklaces and bracelets which she sells independently to different people.  Her working hours are from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and she has been in business for five years, with things going well for her.  In her free time she enjoys going out with her children.  Her goal is to expand her jewelry caft business.  The loan Lourdes is requesting is to buy materials such as cords and stones to make necklaces, braceles and earrings.

She is grateful to everyone taking part in this loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

The other members are involved in businesses such as fabric sales, food sales, a grocery store business and a craft business.

The small photo in the bottom left-hand corner is of a member who could not be present for the group photo for work reasons.

loans.use: To buy materials such as cords and stones to make necklaces, bracelets and earrings.

loans.name: 03.07.25 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiến works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Tiến has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Tiến faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Tiến is 51 years old and is married with three children. She has no dependents because her children are grown up. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Tiến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tiến is the group leader of the 03.07.25 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

With her business profit, Tiến hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 05.02.11 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Ms. Hương has a retail business selling general items. She is requesting a loan to purchase things such as candy, milk, and noodles, to resell. 

Hương is 42 years old and she is single with no children. Hương is the group leader of the 05.02.11 solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for 6 years. The main harship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase general items such as candy, milk, and noodles, to resell

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es: Según referencias de sus vecinos, se pudo afirmar que es un joven trabajador, curso hasta la primaria ya que por cuestiones económicas no prosiguió con sus estudios superiores, viéndose en la necesidad de buscar trabajo y por tanto dejar de lado los estudios; de estado civil soltero pero convive más de 10 años con su conyugue quien participa del presente crédito, tiene dos hijos pequeños, quienes dependen de apoyo moral y económico; indicar además que el Sr. José Miguel tiene gran experiencia en el rubro de la construcción civil ya que lleva más de 10 años en esta actividad; hoy solicita el presente crédito para poder refaccionar el techo de la vivienda en la cual habita, ya que con el crédito se le otorgue  ayudara a poder vivir  dignamente ya que se encuentra muy deteriorada y de esa forma brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
According to references from his neighbors, it was possible to affirm that he’s a hardworking young man.  He completed primary school but due to economic questions was unable to continue with higher education for he needed to seek work so had to leave his schooling aside.  

He’s single but has lived for more than ten years with his spouse who participates in this loan.  He has two small children who depend on him for moral and economic support.  

It’s noted also that José Miguel has vast experience in civil construction since he’s been in this activity for more than ten years.  Today, he’s asking for the present loan to be able to repair his house’s roof.  With the granted loan he will be able to live properly because it’s quite damaged and in this way he’ll provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the roof.

loans.name: María Gilma

texts.es:
María Gilma Madre de hogar y felizmente casada a los 45 años de edad vela por la seguridad y la economía de su familia y junto a sus esposo son los que arduamente trabajan para el sustento del hogar, María por su parte lo hace por venta de mercancía que emprendió con su hijo hace 2 meses con productos amway en donde se enfocan en productos de salud, belleza, hogar y productos de aseo personal, donde sus clientes potenciales son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares de la ceja y otras partes. Ella trabaja en sus tiempos libres ya que ella trabaja con un cultivo flores.
El préstamo será invertido en compra de surtido, y este será un gran apalancamiento para generar mayores ingresos a su hogar
texts.en:
45-year old María Gilma is a happily married wife and mother. She watches out for the wellbeing and financial security of her family. Both she and her husband work hard to maintain their household.

María sells Amway products such as health and beauty items, as well as household and personal hygiene products. She and her son trained to do this two months ago. Her potential customers are her friends, neighbours, and relatives from La Ceja and other areas. Even in her free time María continues working...growing flowers.

The loan money will be used to buy stock and will be a great advantage in generating more income.

loans.use: Buy stock

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

Rosita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Рачабали 36 лет. Он женат, имеет одного сына и двух дочерей, с которыми он проживает в городе Куляб. Его жена домохозяйка, она ухаживает за детьми и ведет домашнее хозяйство. Рачабали как глава семьи сам обеспечивает семью. В последние два года он зарабатывает на жизнь работая наемным водителем. Рачабали хочет начать собственный бизнес в данной области. Он уже отложил немного денег для покупки машины. Его сбережение составляет 5724 сомони (TJS). Для осуществления цели Рачабали просит кредит в размере 1850 долларов США. Рачабали планирует предоставлять услуги такси по маршрутной линии город Куляб - город Душанбе и в день в среднем осуществлять один рейс. Он сейчас очень нуждается в поддержке.
texts.en: Rajabali is 36 years old.  He is married and has one son and two daughters, with whom he lives in the city of Kulob.  His wife is a homemaker; she takes care of the children and runs the household.  Rajabali, as the head of household, provides for the family.  He has been earning a living by working as a hired driver for the last two years.  Rajabali wants to start his own business in this field.  He already saved some money to purchase a car.  His savings amount to 5724 somoni (TJS).  Rajabali is requesting a loan in the amount of 1850 US dollars in order to fulfill his dream.  Rajabali plans to provide taxi services along the Kulob-Dushanbe route and make this trip once per day on average.  He now really needs support.

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to start his own business of providing taxi services

loans.name: 05.06.11 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu  has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothes and clothing repair service.

Thu is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children. Thu is the group leader of the 05.06.11 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 9 members. Thu lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province, because her children are grown up.

In 2009, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thu  has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thu has been involved in this business for 6 years.The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothes and clothing repair service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a modern computerized sewing machine and fabrics for sewing in order to grow her business

loans.name: Ngano Group

texts.en:
Miriam, who is in her early 30s, is married. Together with her husband, she has been blessed with a boy, who is enrolled in school. She is doing fine with her business and family as well. 

For three years now, Miriam has had a retail shop enterprise which offers a variety of products, such as dry foods, sugar, salt, flour, soft drinks like juices and soda, etc. She is also selling airtime. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. (night) daily, and she is able to make a good profit per month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania---Miriam: This will be her seventh loan request, which she will use to replenish more highly demanded and necessity items like dry food and sugar, so as to meet customer retention and attraction. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she managed to purchase new missing items in her shop and to replace the sold ones with more. With the profit from the business, Miriam covered school fees, home expenses and ploughed back into her enterprise. She dreams one day to be able to expand her enterprise into a big shop with more varieties of products. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, “Ngano", which consists of 11 members. Ngano's members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish more highly demanded and necessity items like dry food and sugar, so as to meet customer retention and attraction.

loans.name: Cemira

texts.es:
Cemira tiene años, es viuda, vive en su casa propia junto su nuera y sus 3 nietos. 
Cemira se dedica al alquilo de cuartos para solteros en su propia casa, contando con 10 habientes, brindando cómodas y confortable  habitaciones  ganándose la preferencias de sus cliente.  Tiene más de 10 años dedicándose  a éste negocio.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y le permite tener una ocupación y sentirse una persona productiva. Además de considerar a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene y las ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar y construir más cuartos par así aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
Este será el tercero préstamo con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. 
Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de materiales como maderas y listones para ampliar y construir más cuartos.
texts.en:
Cemira is a widow and lives in her own house with her daughter-in-law and three grandchildren.  She earns a living renting out rooms at home where she has ten guests who are loyal because of the comfort she offers.  Cemira has been in business for ten years.

She likes her work because it generates a good income and keeps her busy and feeling productive.  She also believes the business is profitable because of the market demand.  Therefore she has plans to expand and build more rooms to increase her income.

This is her third Kiva loan and she is happy knowing she will have this financial support which gives her more confidence to advance in her business.

Cemira will use the 1,000 PEN to buy materials such as wood and wooden strips to build more rooms.

loans.use: To buy materials such as wood and wooden strips to build more rooms.

loans.name: Claudia Helena

texts.es: Claudia tiene 40 años y es madre soltera de dos hijos de 20 y 5 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de mercancía y con los ahorros de esta labor se asoció con una hermana que tenía un negocio de producción de arepas. En la actualidad producen diariamente entre 400 y 500 paquetes de arepas, las cuales comercializan en tiendas de barrio. Solicita el crédito para compra de materia prima (maíz) e instrumentos para la producción de arepas pequeñas. El sueño de Claudia es que su negocio le permita brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is 40 years old and is a single mother with 2 children aged 20 and 5 years old. Previously she earned a living selling merchandise and with the money she saved from doing this she went into partnership with a sister who had a business producing arepas [grilled corn cakes]. At present they produce between 400 and 500 packets of arepas per day, which they sell in the local shops. 

She is asking for the loan to buy raw ingredients (corn) and equipment for making small arepas. Claudia's dream is that her business will enable her to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients (corn) and equipment for making small arepas [grilled corn cakes]

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns additional income from selling fish. 

Cristina is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stock such as soap, milk, canned goods, etc. for her general store business. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as soap, milk, and canned goods

loans.name: Yahuar Maqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Leoncio él es casado tiene 55 años y tiene 3 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, él socio lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio vende lo que son productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, él socio a la vez cuenta con un grupo musical, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de azúcar y leche para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de taller de mecánica, negocio de restaurant, venta de mochilas, venta de golosinas.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Yahuar Maqui” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  Leoncio, 55, is a member.  He’s married and has three children.  He alternates his daily activities with a grocery business.  He’s been in business for years and does well thanks to the daily effort he puts into his business.  He sells basic family staples like rice, sugar and milk, among others.  At the same time he’s part of a musical group and this is how he supports his family.  He requests the loan to buy sugar and milk for his business.  He’s grateful to all those who share his dream by this means and commits to make his payments as scheduled.

The members who appear in the inserted photos asked permission to be late because of work.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 56 años, está divorciada y vive en su propia casa. 
Carmen se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles que vende desde su tienda instalada en su propia casa, iniciándose hace 02 años, ahora contando con la ayuda de sus hijos en la atención a sus clientes.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su casa, así como el tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en otras actividades, igualmente los ingresos económicos que le genera los cuales usa en los gastos de su hogar. 
También tiene planes de abrir otro negocio que sería un restaurante en su casa ya que tiene conocimientos de cocina y desea ponerlos en práctica.
Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. 
Con el monto de 600 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, y harinas para vender.
texts.en:
Carmen, 56, is divorced and lives in her own home where she runs a grocery store and has been in business for two years.  Her children help tend to customers.

She likes her work because it allows her to be in the comfort of her home while also having free time to do other things; and it generates an income with which to cover the household expenses.

Carmen has plans to open another business at home which will be a restaurant.  She knows how to cook and wants to use her expertise.

This is her second Kiva loan and she hopes to receive the small amount she is requesting to meet her goals.  She will use the 600 PEN to buy food items such as rice, sugar and flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy food items such as rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y vive en su propia casa junta su esposo.
Carmela se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, para eso cuenta con una tienda que está instalada en su casa donde tiene los  más surtidos y variados productos.
Se inició hace más de 10 años, luego fue aumentando, logrando hacer crecer sus capital de trabajo, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su esposo en sus ratos libres. Ahora se siente  tranquila por los ingresos de tiene, ahora que puede apoyar a su familia.
Por tanto,  viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, desea continuar con su negocio y ampliar su espacio para poner mayor cantidad de productos. Este será su tercer préstamo con Kiva. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.
Con el monto de  4000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, harina, entre otros para seguir creciendo a su tienda.
texts.en:
Carmela is 53, married and lives in her own home with her husband. Carmelo sells food products and has a store set up in her home where she has a wide variety of products. It was started more than 10 years ago; later she began expanding, and managed to make her working capital grow. Up to now she has been running it with the support of her husband in his free time. 

She feels happy about her income, now that she can support her family. Seeing the good results she has, she wishes to continue with her business and expand her space so that she can display a greater number of products. 

This will be her third loan with Kiva,  so she hopes for a small loan so that she can fulfill her objectives. With the amount 4000 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of miscellaneous groceries, such as rice, sugar, flour and other products, so that she can keep expanding her store.

loans.use: To buy food products such as rice, sugar and flour so that she can expand her store.

loans.name: Alberto Teodoro

texts.es: El señor Alberto tiene 69 años, es casado y padre de dos hijos. Se encuentra hace 5 años dedicado al negocio que empezó su familia dedicado a la piscicultura. El negocio lo desarrolla en su casa donde se dedica a la cría y comercialización de Cachama y Bocachico en los dos pozos que tiene. El señor Alberto trabaja todos los días de la semana y es el único empleado de su negocio, además los conocimientos que aplica a éste, los ha adquirido empíricamente. Solicita el crédito para la compra de concentrado para alimentar las Cachamas y Bocachicos de los dos pozos. además sus sueños son la construcción de varios pozos y el fortalecimiento del negocio de comercialización de los peces.
texts.en:
Alberto, 69, is married and the father of two children.

For five years he has worked in the fishery business his family started.  He does business in his house where he raises and sells cachama and bocachico fish in his two tanks.  Alberto works every day of the week and is the only employee of his business.  He learned what he knows on the job.

He's requesting the loan to buy feed for the cachama and bocachico fish.

His dreams are to build various tanks and to strengthen his business selling fish.

loans.use: to buy fish feed

loans.name: Alcina

texts.en:
Alcina is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk in 2007 with her own working capital of $200. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as slippers, basins, kettles, baskets and other items.
 
Alcina is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, basins, kettles, baskets and other items.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es casado, tienen tres hijos, radica en el trópico de Cochabamba desde  hace 8 años. El señor Juan vino de su comunidad por que la producción es muy baja debido a los cambios climatológicos, por lo que decidió irse al trópico en busca de una mejor vida, pero con el trascurso del tiempo, con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo se compro su lote agrícola, en el que produce  yuca. El crédito que está solicitando es para construcción de vivienda, de esta manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida y tendrá un techo adecuado para vivir junto a su señora que le colabora en sus actividades agrícolas.
texts.en:
Juan is married and has three children.  For eight years he has lived in the tropics of Cochabamba after leaving his own community because of low production due to the climate change.  He decided to go to the tropics in search of a better life, and over time, through much hard work and effort, was able to buy farm land where he grows yucca plant.

The loan Juan is requesting is to build a decent house for his family to improve their lifestyle.  His wife works with him in the agricultural activity.

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 29-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, and this is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. 

Presently, he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife, Samina, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. 

With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Samina is very thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 67 years old, married, and has ten children. 

Arsenia is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Arsenia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vaccines, and vitamins for her business. Arsenia has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Arsenia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vaccines and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn at wholesale prices and cal

loans.name: Brahian Stiven

texts.es: Stiven, a sus 19 años de edad, ya cuenta con amplia experiencia en el campo laboral, se ha dedicado a trabajar como obrero de construcción y así ha obtenido dinero para aportar al sostenimiento de sus padres, pero debido a que la construcción es una actividad muy inestable e incierta, ha decidido iniciar con un negocio propio en el campo de la panadería, para lo cual ya cuenta con el horno, la pipeta de gas propano y la batidora. Requiere el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos (harina de trigo, levadura, azúcar, huevos, leche, entre otros) y realizar unas adecuaciones en el local que tomó en arriendo. Stiven es un joven visionario y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por eso desea ahorrar para montar su negocio en un local propio que esté ubicado en un sector con gran afluencia de gente, para así incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindarle a sus padres el bienestar y la mejor calidad de vida posible, para retribuir el gran esfuerzo que hicieron para sacarlo adelante.
texts.en:
Stiven, 19, already has a vast working experience in the construction sector where he has earned enough  to support his parents.  But since it is an unstable business, he has decided to branch out on his own in the bakery field.  He has an oven, propane gas and a mixer but needs a loan to buy supplies (flour, yeast, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.) and renovate the locale he has rented.

Stiven is a young visionary who is determined to get ahead.  He wants to save enough to open his own shop in a busy area in order to increase his income and give his parents the well being and quality of life he can to pay them back for all they did in raising him.

loans.use: To buy supplies (flour, yeast, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.) and renovate the bakery he is renting.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 51 years old and married, with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks, like canned goods, milk, noodles, eggs, and cream.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. Jocelyn aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, milk, noodles, eggs, and cream.

loans.name: Auxiliadora De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Auxiliadora es de la ciudad de Concepción, vive con sus padres y su Abuela. Cuenta que su meta es terminar su carrera y ser una buena profesional.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de obstetricia, con lo cual quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas a traer algo tan lindo como son los bebes. Su sueño siempre ha sido ese y por medio de estos estudios esta en camino a cumplirlo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de materiales para la universidad, ya que son muy costosos y esto le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora is from the city of Concepción; she lives with her parents and grandmother.  She relates that her goal is to complete her career and become a good professional.  She’s studying Obstetrics that she wants to use to help others bring something as precious as babies.  That has always been her dream and by means of these studies she’s on the road to reaching it.  

She requests this loan to buy supplies for university since they are very costly; this will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy supplies for university.

loans.name: 05.04.13 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Ms. Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling sweet rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

Dung is 56 years old and she is single with two children. Dung is the group leader of the 05.04.13 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents because her children are grown up.

In 2009, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung has been involved in this business for nine years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Using her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is requesting a new loan to buy rubber materials to make sandal soles. Lang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in further expanding the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rubber materials to make sandal soles

loans.name: Eugemia

texts.en:
Eugemia is 62 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Eugemia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Eugemia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bundles of nylon and other fishing materials for her business.

Eugemia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Eugemia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bundles of nylon and other fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Wuilmer Antonio

texts.es: Wuilmer, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive en el municipio de Protección, Santa y Bárbara junto a su madre. El se dedica a la construcción y  hace mas de 2 años comenzó con el cultivo de  café, frijoles  y maíz. El préstamo que  Wuilmer  solicito es por  L.10,000  y los invertirá en la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de la finca de café como es abono y fertilizantes. Su objetivo es mantener mejor la finca para sacar buena producción y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en: Wuilmer is 23 years old, single, and lives with his mother in the municipality of Protección  in the department of Santa Barbara. He works in construction and has also been growing coffee, beans, and corn for over 2 years. The loan of L 10,000 that Wuilmer is requesting is to invest in the purchase of maintenance supplies for his coffee plantation such as manure and fertilizers. His goal is to keep the plantation in good condition so that it will produce more and, in that way, he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to fertilize his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 42 years old and is from Kutaisi district. He lives with his wife Nino and their parents who are provided with a retirement pension. Nino works at local pharmacy and gets a small monthly income. Unfortunately, her salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family of four. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.  

So, Gela decided to start his own business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Gela’s credit requests were rejected several times, as he was not able to satisfy their requirements. He received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of $1500, Gela will purchase all the raw materials and open a window-and-door workshop. He will get orders to prepare different kinds of windows and doors. He is experienced in this field, as he had been working in such a workshop, so he thinks that the business will be profitable. 

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to open a workshop and get orders to prepare windows and doors

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 34 years old and a married woman and has been running a business of milk sales with her husband for five years. She has one cow in milk and sells its milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Rubina is a mother of five children, all school-going. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to increase her sales, she needs to purchase another cow. For this she requested a loan of Rs 20,000/- from Kashf Foundation. She is on her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business further in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Aïhoué Irène

texts.fr: Aïhoué Irène âgée de 34 ans est mariée à Isaac, un chauffeur. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Aïhoué Irène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Aïhoué Irène n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Aïhoué Irène vend des tissus, du charbon de bois et divers autres articles par la méthode de distribution depuis vingt ans. Aïhoué Irène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Aïhoué Irène sollicite pour la troisième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Aïhoué Irène,  34 years old, is married to Isaac, a driver. The couple have two children, both enrolled in school.  Aïhoué Irène lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in covering the various expenses of the household. 

 Aïhoué Irène did not go to school. To be able to afford her family's needs, she has been selling lengths of cloth, charcoal, and other items by the distribution method for 20 years. 

Aïhoué Irène buys her wares in a market in Benin, in Togo. In order to grow her working capital and satisfy the demand of her clientele, she is asking for her third loan from ALIDé. Her prior loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy cloth and charcoal, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Xuyen is requesting another loan to buy a range of new beverage products in order to stock her store.  This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers.  Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer the customers a greater variety of products.  Xuyen hopes that this new loan will assist her with increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and also helping to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 44-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of animals’ sales for the past 15 years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. Now she has three buffaloes. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is a mother of three and is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

In order to purchase one more cow and feed for her buffaloes, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000/-. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely be able to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for her buffaloes.

loans.name: Sandra Aracely

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 30 años de edad, esta acompañada y es madre de dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 12 años su papá le enseño el oficio; hoy que es madre ella sigue enseñándole a sus hijos y sigue trabajando con su padre; ya que su compañero de vida no dispone de tiempo para ayudarle en la agricultura. Se levanta alas 5: A.M para preparar a sus hijos para mandarlos a la escuela, después aprovecha para ir a la milpa a las 12: A.M ella regresa a la casa a preparar el almuerzo a sus hijos y cuidar de ellos ayudarles en sus tareas y compartir con ellos.

Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad, para llegar hasta ahí camina unos cuarenta y cinco minutos, hasta el lugar en donde aborda el autobús que la conduce a la ciudad. 

El préstamo sera utilizado en la compra de 50 bolsas de cemento y 4 quintales de hierro y lo demás para pagar el albañil. Para construir su casa de ladrillo; ya que con esfuerzo a logrado comprar los otros materiales que falta el cemento y el hierro y la mano de obra. Su vida mejorara grandemente, ya que actualmente vive en una casa alquilada.


Ella, pretende ahorrar para pagar el crédito y tener las puertas abiertas; ver va sus hijos graduados de la universidad.
texts.en:
Sandra is 30 years old. She lives with her partner and is the mother of two children. She has been farming since she was 12 years old. Her father taught her the occupation, and now that she is a mother, she continues teaching it to her children. She is still working with father, as her partner doesn't have the time available to help her with the farming.

She gets up at 5 a.m. to get her children ready for school, and afterwards makes use of this time to go the fields. At noon she comes home to prepare lunch for the children, look after them, help them with their homework, and share time with them. She acquires agricultural supplies in a city, and to get there walks around 45 minutes to the place where she gets on the bus that goes to the city. 

The loan will be used to purchase 50 bags of cement, 400 kg of rebar, and the rest to pay a builder to construct her brick house. With effort she has managed to buy the other materials, and what she needs is the cement, the rebar and the labor. Her life will improve greatly, as currently she lives in a rented house.

She plans to save to pay off the loan, be open to new opportunities, and see her children graduate from university.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of cement, 400 kg of rebar, and the rest to pay a builder to construct her brick house

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 35 years old and a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruit from the field and sell it in the market at a profitable price. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Manuel José

texts.es: Manuel, a sus 49 años de edad es casado y tiene 6 hijos. Desde muy joven conoció las labores del campo, ya que fue criado allí. Actualmente se dedica a cultivar diversos productos en su finca, y adicionalmente labora como agricultor en otras fincas del sector, para así complementar sus ingresos y llevar el sustento a su hogar. El titular es un señor emprendedor y muy trabajador, se esfuerza día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, por eso labora más de 12 horas diarias, sobrepasando todos los obstáculos que se le presentan en la realización de esta actividad. Manuel decidió solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (glifosato, fungicidas, pesticidas, grosat, abonos) para así continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha de muy buena calidad, para venderla a un buen precio y así incrementar sus ingresos, además desea cumplir una de sus principales metas, que es ampliar sus cultivos y mejorar los resultados de las cosechas que le permitan tener más recursos para poder brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en: Manuel, at age 49, is married and has six children.  He learned to work in the fields when he was very young and grew up there.  He currently raises various products on his farm and also works as a field hand on other farms in the area.  He supplements his income this way so he can support his household and is a very enterprising and hardworking gentleman who works every day to get his family ahead.  He works 12 hours a day, while getting through all the obstacles he faces.  Manuel decided to request this loan so he can invest in farming supplies (Glyphosate, fungicides, pesticides, grosat, fertilizers) to continue his crops and have a good quality harvest that he can sell at a good price.  This way he can increase his income, which is one of his main goals; expanding his crops and improving  the harvests that allows him to provide his children with a good education and a better quality of life for his whole family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita is 42 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  She is from northern Albania.  Drita wants to start a livestock business, raising baby calves and selling them. 

Drita is requesting a loan, which she will use to add three more milk cows to her existing herd.

loans.use: to purchase three milk cows

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. His rickshaw is not working properly, and because of that he is unable to generate income. He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the repair cost. Therefore Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shamim is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Melagrosa

texts.en:
Melagrosa is married and has three adult children. She is  from CPP, Bohol, Melagrosa and is engaged in the fishing business together with her husband, which she has been doing for seven years.

Melagrosa is requesting  a loan, which she will use to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Melagrosa hopes to expand their business in the future and makes it a success.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets

loans.name: Blenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Blenda works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Blenda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Blenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embrodiery material for her business

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta works hard to support her family. Roberta is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Roberta requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for nine years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Roberta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 37 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Eight years ago her husband started his own business of selling welding material. 

Rukhsana is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to increase his supply of welding products, including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, and welding rods, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Rukhsana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase welding products

loans.name: Quenie

texts.en: Quenie is married and works hard to support her family through the fishing/fish vending business she has been operating in the Philippines for five years now. She has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for fishing. In the future, Quenie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for fishing

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business. Rowena is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, sugar, coffee, chips and noodles to sell in her general store.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, coffee, chips and noodles

loans.name: Wave Stars Group

texts.en:
Naomi is 36 years old, single, and has two children who attend school.  She is from Mutare, Zimbabwe and is a member of the group called Wave Stars.  Naomi runs a business selling chickens, which she has been doing for three years. 

Naomi is requesting a loan for $600, which she will use to buy more chicks and feeds. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to boost her business and improve general family welfare. The main challenges she faces are lack of working capital and stiff competition.  In the future, Naomi plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feeds for a poultry project

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is a 42-year-old married man with two daughters living in the capital city of Tbilisi. Paata’s wife stays home, taking care of the children. Paata is unemployed at the moment. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, especially among people up to 40. The only source of income for the family is a small amount earned by Paata serving the locals as a taxi driver with his car. Several days ago he had an accident, and unfortunately his taxi was smashed. Paata was uninsured and now is requesting credit to fix the car.

His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and MFO, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $500 will help Paata to pay for the repair of his car. He will continue working and transport the passengers inter-city. Paata is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person with a great desire to ensure his children get a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Paata is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Waheeda

texts.en:
Waheeda is married and has three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns an artificial jewelry shop which is the only source of income for the family.  

Waheeda is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to purchase artificial jewelry, such as bangles, necklaces, rings, and bracelets, for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for the business. Her husband plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns.

loans.use: to purchase artificial jewelry for her husband's shop

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: La Sra. Albina vive en la comunidad de Colomi tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura siembra en terreno de 1 Ha herencia de sus padres produce papa, oca y haba en vaina verde con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 2 de engorde y 1 lecheras. La Sra. Albina requiere el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico 1 camión y semilla de papa ya que quiere aprovechar esta época porque los precios son bajos y le entregan en el mismo lugar.
texts.en:
Albina lives in the Colomi community, she is 43 years old, single and financially independent.  She works in agriculture and plants on a 1 hectare lot owned by her parents.  She produces potatoes, yams and green beans in rotation given her experience with the items.  She also has cattle, 2 being raised for meat and 1 dairy cow. 

Albina is requesting a loan in order to purchase a truck load of organic fertilizer and potato seeds because she wants to take advantage of the low prices during this season.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: 04-11-10-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Ms. Huyến operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables and fruit to resell.

Huyến is 51 years old and she is single with 2 children. Huyến is the group leader of the 04-11-10-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents: her children are grown up.

In 2012, Huyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huyến has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huyến has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Huyến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huyến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruit to resell.

loans.name: Melodin

texts.en:
Melodin is married and works hard to support her family. She has a machine shop business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Melodin is requesting a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which he will use loan to buy materials such as welding rods, welding machine, and acetylene for her business.  In the future, Melodin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as welding rods, welding machine, and acetylene
